G9KMox603835ZDang0a5NA.text: This review is going to kill me, because I want so badly to give them 4-5 stars but just can't...  I have been coming to US Egg since it first opened. Their protein pancakes had me at hello and have been a staple of mine nearly every weekend, whether it be with my wife, my friends, or my parents. I lived in Los Angeles for nearly 5 years, and every time I came back to AZ I hit up US Egg. It seemed like every time I went I received a delicious, piping hot breakfast from an attractive, attentive, happy wait staff. I thought they would be my go-to breakfast place for life...  However, a few years ago they started to branch out, and just like many mom and pop places that try to spread their wings, they fly too close to the sun and their consistency suffers greatly. Over the last 2-3 years, EVERY time I bring someone here, raving about the food and the service...there's a problem. Sausage has been undercooked, eggs were cold, even my beloved pancakes (No! Not my protein pancakes!!!!!) have had zero blueberries in them, have been cold, or have been burned beyond recognition. My parents have had so many bad experiences with their unusually inattentive wait staff that they refuse to go with me now that I have moved back to Scottsdale. It seems like the place is always in a rush and too busy for their own good.  About the only consistent thing about this location is its inconsistency. I have eaten there 3 times in the last month I have been back, and each time has been different. I took my brother in law after a long, early morning hike on a Saturday and the place was just like I remembered...great, friendly wait staff with wonderful, hot breakfasts. We both had the eggs combo with protein pancake upgrade and it was delicious; thick, crispy bacon, piping hot eggs cooked to order, deliciously hot and fluffy pancakes with almond slivers, blueberries, and granola. The other two times...not so much. Both times food was undercooked or cold, and when we requested new food, they nuked it and passed it off as new food!!!!! REALLY?! If there is a bite out of it sweetie, we can tell it's the same sausage patty! It is really disappointing, because this place used to be a bastion of consistency and quality that made it a staple of Old Town breakfast places. I give it 3 stars because there are glimmers of great quality here and there. I just hope that they can find the consistency that once made them one of the best places in town for breakfast.

QTFg1f8Fu1rexJakLNJx1w.text: You will walk away stuffed.  And since the food tastes pretty darn good, it'll make sense as you drive away barely able to breathe.  I have never seen so many egg-based dishes.  There must be something like 3,000 to the 8th power dishes to choose from.  Service is very friendly and responsive.  I wish there was a U.S. Egg in the bay area...

oQoXC5r_J6py1LXPiPsawA.text: oh man, that protein pancake is ah-mazing...i am not huge on pancakes in general, nor sweet items for breakfast, but this dish I would gladly order again and again.  it's perfectly balanced and delicious.  the group shared a protein pancake bc apparently we haven't lived if we do not know it's greatness...SO glad we got one.  in addition to trying the pancake, we all ordered regular/traditional breakfast food.  i had the california benedict, and it was pretty average/standard.    definitely give the protein pancake a whirl if you're curious... i am going to attempt to recreate those pancakes for sure.  fellow Yelpers, any tips/recipes are welcome!

Wj2Fz_UIBq_Dw35YS1cqNA.text: I love breakfast. The food here is really good; I just wish the service lived up to how good the food was. Our waitress never told us her name and was nonexistent throughout the meal. I also ordered a side of sourdough toast and never received it. I ordered the eggs benedict, like always, and I wasn't disappointed. My friend ordered a blueberry muffin that was by far one of the best muffins I've ever had. My other friend wanted to substitute something for eggs in her meal and the waitress refused to work with her and basically just told her she couldn't. The least she could have done was ask a manager first. I'd eat here again just because the food was good, but I'd hope the service was better next time.

PqOxKpuH3xPt6nkUp7Ya_Q.text: Expensive for breakfast but worth it. Friendly cute staff, plenty of creative menu items and free wifi. The protein pancakes are gonna make you smile and if you are trying to hydrate this is your place. They serve every table with an iced and lemoned pitcher of aqua. The mural of America was fun to study.

ijjqHctFgBLQxLoUraTGyQ.text: Mediocre service and sub-par food quality.  I'd rather make my own breakfast than go here.  If you're committed to having someone else scramble your eggs go to a nicer place that focuses more on quality rather than quantity...seriously this place is huge and you won't really enjoy yourself.  I know I didn't.  There are plenty of other places to go in the immediate area...I just really don't think this place is getting into a car and driving for.

IFsluA2Yi4iPF-MvcBnKLw.text: I love US Egg.  The Protein Pancakes are awesome.  I put the Protein pancakes in the Triple Play, it comes with Eggs and Bacon.  Good way to start the day.  Friendly staff and the owners all ways are there to greet and say hello.

29lDubXEJphDHTRAsps1IA.text: Come here every year when I'm in Scottsdale for Spring Training. After a night of drinking and sporting a huge hangover this place saves me every time. The portions are huge  and the service is quick and friendly. Sometimes there's a long wait to get in though. It's a painful walk here from the hotel, but I leave with a skip in my step to Scottsdale Stadium

1nj60kwo8JAG4r4WZF5QGA.text: Great breakfast before golfing in Scottsdale. Had really great omelette with a side of fruit & rye toast.  Boyfriend loved his breakfast also. Wait staff was super friendly and brought pitchers of iced tea & diet coke so we never ran out. Quick and efficient, it was the best breakfast we had on our trip.

fZpiAppj_p6qfNLraTffdQ.text: Waffle me!!!  Great place for brunch but sometimes you will have to wait.  I have never had any complaints about the food or service.  Food comes out fast and hot.  The staff are helpful and very welcoming.  Ask for Rachel....she's the best!  I do love their breakfast potatoes.  The waffle with strawberries was the waffle fix I needed.  They have everything you could possibly want for breakfast or lunch.  Every time I go in I have a hard time deciding on what to eat but I am never disappointed.  Is it breakfast time?

UjwHXCUErEPy1-BFPL8aWQ.text: Good easy place!  Breakfast food is great and I'd stick with that!  I ordered a sandwich which wasn't too bad, wife had their special pancakes and definitely won.

uQNNDeSw87Mr42nNo63HPw.text: I've always had good service here, unlike the Tempe location. I've never had to wait and the food is always fresh and yummy. Also... totally saw Dan Majerle waiting for a table there once.

Kt09QI4j0f97YX1O144KxA.text: The US Egg is awesome! I love their protein pancakes and their staff is very friendly. I've tried a few other things at this restaurant; however, if you've never been here before, the protein pancakes are a must!  Once when I was there my food came out wrong. I told the waitress that it was fine, and I would eat it. The manager/owner came over and apologized and comped my entire meal. I thought it was really great how they take care of their customers. I would recommend this place if you've never been there.

uSapqrj3J7o-mPi6tsL-zg.text: Always a pleasure to eat here. Friendly service and great breakfast. I'll continue to make this one of my breakfast destinations.

inqvAFNNr0gV7U1X1gwqmQ.text: Protein pancakes the best ever here.  Huge menu as well, the arizona frittata is another fav

vbxKJTkmGD7RlCG_6QVxtQ.text: Love this place- consistently good and friendly. Portions may even be too large. Come here for breakfast when visiting AZ twice a year and will keep coming back.

rwvKqQ57ndcRvFLyWQ0K7Q.text: Breakfast here before a long drive from Scottsdale to Sacramento. Had the US Egg sandwich which was very good. Thick bacon and a lot of cheese. Very clean restaurant and restrooms. "Sam" our waitress was very good!

RZ9c3eZ1FUvk6zvlV1qytA.text: I have been eating here for 15 years and the food is better and better every time. I was so lucky. The restaurant opened up after hours to host my rehearsal dinner for my wedding. They customized menus and even had gluten free selections for me. We really wanted breakfast under the stars and the whole crew made that possible. The food was amazing. The service was impeccable. The care and concern everyone put forth will be treasured. We were so pleased with everything that we returned to the US Egg on Wednesday for breakfast (Tempe Location). No matter what location you are at, you will have a great meal, service and experience. I highly recommend US Egg. You can't go wrong with the protein cakes, skillets, and more. Thanks Gebran for amazing me! We are so fortunate you agreed to do so much for us. May your kindness be returned 10 fold.

2Z3Oywl6AKe3ApWSPiXUow.text: I've never had something that I didn't love here. I really love the protein pancakes. It's not often that I order the same thing more than once because I like to try new things, but I can't get enough of the pancakes!

bx7ihhigVmbLw99ZYGZrdw.text: Great tasting food, and great environment!   Was visiting Scottsdale and was looking for somewhere for breakfast on Yelp, and remembered seeing this place on my way up the night before. Got there (it was around noon), and was immediately sat and the staff was very helpful. Staff consisted of cute 20-something girls, which was an added... ahemmmm... bonus?   Anyhow, got the US Egg cheesesteak sandwich which was awesome,  and my friend got one of the skillet items which was equally tastey. All with drinks for about $28 with tax and tip. Would love to do it again!

Htf4m00HeYFwhBJbkie54A.text: They turn my Saturday into a happy Saturday. There was a line when I went there, I have waited about 2 mins then seated. Employees are cheerful and kind.   I have tried Idaho skillets and that was great. The only thing is I like to eat my breakfast with bread like food. They served English muffin but the muffin was small I think. Other than that, everything was great

0RDMLCiKnGii7tTbhpDCgQ.text: Excellent place for breakfast! When you walk in the place is one big room. Booths separate the center of the room with tables all around. We were there for late breakfast so it was not crowded at all. Service was quick, attentive and courteous. I was most impressed with the fresh fruit. Most places cut fruit early so some dry out of get slimy. This fruit was none of those thing! It was on the cheap side even though we ate healthy. Great decor inside! Will def come back!

Pk96QndwTpmx_k-49GJN5Q.text: The protein pancakes with granola and cinnamon we're amazing. If you order the half and half it is pretty small and you will still be a little hungry I bet.

ycpnqf3j9ZxNlaGr8NLHaA.text: Just finished a great breakfast at U.S. Egg. I had the garden omelet and my husband had the protein pancakes. Both were perfectly cooked and taste great. But, the thing that impressed me most about this place was the service. While we were only there about 45 minutes our waitress checked on us about six or seven times. I can't believe I already forgot her name (I think it was Karena). Besides our waitress, the hostess also stopped by the table to make sure we were enjoying our meal. Sure, it wasn't a Saturday or Sunday morning, but I consider that to be exceptional service by any standards.

7VAxTs0NwaKUq_ydczJ4OA.text: Really solid breakfast food, perfect for the morning after a fun night. Hearty fare and fresh ingredients, served efficiently with a smile. Lots of standard choices, prepared well.  From the moment you walk in the door, it's pleasant, efficient service. The place is huge, so I've never had to wait long and it was great whether there were two or six in my party.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half and half: 2 protein pancakes and a veggie skillet breakfast with one egg - my husband loved it :)
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Two eggs sunny side up with rye toast and hash browns. Perfect!!

QPwYBuvM2O9j7XB4cKSsCw.text: We have been going to this US Egg location for about 6 years and usually it's the best.  However, today we had one of the worst dining experiences imaginable.  The worst thing about it was the way the management chose to handle it.  Here's a snapshot: --Party of 4:  2 adults + 2 toddlers.  We were shown to our table immediately. --About 15-20 minutes went by without anyone stopping at our table to even address us. --Finally our order was taken - we ordered two kids breakfasts and two standard items off the menu. --35 minutes later our food had still not arrived.  During that time, our server never once stopped by, checked to see if we needed refills, or indicated anything unusual about our order. --My wife walked up to the host stand to check on the status that was followed by no updates. --Still nobody came over to our table until finally our food arrived - 40 minutes after we ordered it (and a full hour after we sat down at the table with two toddlers). --One of our kid's meals was missing - the server never even placed the order to begin with. --Server started making excuses about how busy they were.  However, we regularly go to this locations on Sunday mornings and they are typically far busier - even with a wait to get a table - and we never have to wait that long for our food. --We explained that we come often and that it never takes this long - and she then challenged us by snootily asking "do you ever come on Sundays?"  To which we responded yes - all the time.  Then she became even more argumentative and said "Well, have you come during Spring Training?"  Of course we have.  And we've been there when it's far busier than it was today and it's never taken this long. --Finally, after arguing with us, we just demanded that she go and get our son's meal since it was clearly missing (and you can only imagine how much fun it is to be with a toddler who's been waiting an hour for food only to see that the rest of his family has something to eat but he still has to wait). --Even before our son's food arrived, my wife cut into her pancake only to find a nasty, slimy brown hair on her plate underneath it. --The food runner finally brought our son's food and at that point we pointed out the hair on the other plate.  She took it away and said she'd bring back a fresh one. --At no point did our server ever come back to apologize for the hair in the food, for forgetting one of our four orders, or for taking so long for the order. --Furthermore, our drinks were never even refilled the entire hour+ we were at our table. --In the end, they took both kids meals off the bill which surprised us that they didn't offer more consideration for the hairy pancakes.  At that point we were very frustrated and in disbelief about the whole thing.  When she told us about taking off the kids meals, I commented that I was surprised they still wanted to charge us for anything given the hair and the wait.  She rudely snapped "If you are eating it, you are paying for it."  We finally left, made a comment to the manager at the front that it was a terrible experience, and he just shrugged and said "I heard about it."  Clearly he didn't care.  Honestly, if they had just provided the slightest bit of remorse or expressed even a hint of an apology it would have been different.  However, instead the server and management were aloof and certainly didn't prioritize customer service over their desire to charge us.  Of course, we paid our bill as always.  However, if they had simply apologized and taken off my wife's hairy pancakes I would not have felt compelled to post this Yelp review.

flD6gtWOhoUvXyeUzhbIgw.text: There was a time I ate there every week. I loved the Santa Fe skillet. It had great chicken and chorizo together. Then I started getting them with a pile of hash browns and very little else. I ate there today in Chandler because it was closest and we were looking for breakfast. Same exact thing. Totally tasteless almost entirely hash browns for $12.

J9_v8-Grj52gGmr3pGak6w.text: Maybe I'm not a fan of diner food.   Service was very friendly on a busy Sunday morning. Restaurant was huge, but the decor was a bit tacky. We had the Cali Eggs Benedict, protein pancakes, waffles, and a veggie skillet. After a night of debauchery, we needed some serious comfort food.  The portions are huge but everything was mediocre and forgettable.   Perfect example of why there is a portion control issue in our country.  I did like 1 thing, the double carafe coffee on the table so we can help ourselves with coffee refills.

RPg_cOUY40PqpYloKTCCuA.text: Great chicken fried steak, eggs Benedict and mimosas. Wasn't busy, but at 10 am on a Friday what do you expect?  We were taking up table space, granted, as we visited with friends,  but it would have been nice if they had offered to refill waters.  Will be back next time in Phoenix.

EX_LsR1BGU-GZ9n-cJWLjQ.text: Second time here on my travels.  You cannot go wrong with this place that has southwest flavor for its meals.  Swapped out fruit for breakfast which was LARGE plate of fresh fruit.  Very nice!

qGttY86RqobhV8K0V4XLoA.text: Food was really good. But environment and service not the best. Really good place for breakfast  skillets was really good

C-2hjOhApDfnniL1Qd4Dyg.text: US Egg is my go-to breakfast joint every weekend. I have celiacs and their large menu of gluten free items is amazing. They have gluten free toast, waffles, and french toast. Plus they adjust many of their menu items for a food allergy if you just ask. Love it!

BUo_ZLKfC3M9RdxiPy2sWQ.text: The first time at this location. Came here after a charity walk that was close by. Service was good, but more than one person including me out of the party of seven said the food was bland.   I had the meat lover skillet which was a good portion but the hash was not cooked long enough to be crispy. The gravy with chicken fried steak had no taste other than salt.   Service was good enough to merit another chance here.

rB0u7NFDmPq59ZmpAgZYcA.text: I love this place! The protein pancakes keep me coming back. A lower carb option, it lets me splurge on a tasty breakfast without too much guilt. I usually order those and a side of super crispy bacon. They even have sugar free maple syrup, just ask! Check the hours to avoid disappointment; they close around 2 pm. You won't have much of a wait if you come during the week at lunchtime, but expect a long wait time if you want to eat at peak breakfast or brunch hours on weekends. Always friendly service and good food. Love how they leave a big carafe of ice water on your table so you never have to wait for a server to refill your glass. One of my favorite places to dine in Scottsdale.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Protein pancakes have a great texture.
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Protein pancakes and a side of bacon. Yummy.
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sugar free, low carb syrup. Just ask for it!

IB-ADh9EFUYWEoEIQoShdQ.text: Top notch breakfast spot in old town Scottsdale. They literally have everything for everyone to enjoy. Perfect for families or if you just want to eat alone. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming and all the servers have smiles on their faces. Our server, Bailey was wonderful! Very attentive to our table and took great care of us. We will be back!

P8-vq2YhLD8gXJ6eg1E_bA.text: We have been loyal US Egg fans since we started coming to Spring Training in 2014. Unfortunately, our experience yesterday at this location was one that had us seeking a new breakfast place. Service was great as usual, but all of the food in our party of 5 people was cold. I, personally, didn't say anything because I thought maybe it was just mine. After we left and got to talking, we all said the same thing.....food was cold (not just lukewarm, but cold).  Again, unfortunate because we've always enjoyed coming here and raved (and recommended) it to others.

SCD49pgUD43nZwAkDf6-7w.text: I found this DIAMOND over 7 years ago!! I continue to be amazed by the consistency of high quality service coupled with high quality food.  Living in Scottsdale there are so many choices to eat. Restaurants are everywhere. It is like a concrete jungle of eateries. The only way I have ever found to separate the pretenders from the real deal 5 star establishments is SERVICE, FLAVOR, VARIETY, CONSISTENCY AND EXECUTION!! US Egg understands that. They get it, which is why they are head and shoulders above any other breakfast and lunch eatery in all of Scottsdale.

KAPGjMrTQtuNxTaK5eqdsQ.text: We're from Chicago and THIS breakfast place is a must try. Absolutely recommend it. Fast, friendly and comfortable environment.  Portion is huge. Everyone is very nice and prices so reasonable. Breakfast is not my favorite meal but THIS place makes me wish breakfast was every meal of the day :) nice huge menu might be back for lunch. Excellent. Id give it 10 stars.  The meat skillet and the avocado chicken and bacon skillet outstanding. Thanks to yelp! Btw, Vanessa and Sarah are GEMS to this establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Meat skillet amd the avocado chicken and bacon skillet... Oh my perfection

QXAvAnrlWG--AMfd0WFP5Q.text: Ordered the eggs Benedict. Did not have a pleasant first experience but manager George made it right and invited us back to give it another chance! I really appreciate his time and effort to better our experience.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

8l2ahlmI069rlO9VaDQ0KQ.text: Another great breakfast!  The half and half  with protein pancakes and a ham, sausage and mushroom Idaho skillet.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The half and half.  Always a good choice.

CLW79C3a04yt7qpugw_0_A.text: Took the family here for a morning meal on our vacation. Yelped it first and found the reviews to be spot on. Good solid breakfast food. Great for the kids. The protein pancakes were AMAZING! Loved it! What stood out more than the good food was the sparkling service. The manager/owner and his staff were amazing! I can't say enough about them. This is a good place to patronize, they are doing everything right. Next time I'm in Phoenix I'm definately coming to US Eggs!

ZkNP5jTLEWZCdMW6J_BfCg.text: This place is a great breakfast restaurant. Everything I have tried has been delicious. The owners are very friendly and make you feel like your dining at home.  The service is always top notch.  I recommend trying the protein pancakes.

U2SgReV1X8IiiI3waL4F8w.text: 2 Words: PROTEIN PANCAKES   They are delish!! This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in town. Everything on the menu looks great, but every time I tell myself I will venture and order something different... I can't. I guess thats a good problem to have :)  P.S. They are ginormous so plan on sharing or taking some home for later.

3GSlJ3A-GkX1K5LfZbUZ3Q.text: perfect breakfast spot with quality ingredients and reasonable prices.  definitely enjoy my brunches here with my family.  service is fast and efficient and wait time is usually 20 minutes on busy mornings. will definitely return!

7gcmkYSSkr_2KYplaYsOHA.text: Everything that is bad about a breakfast place in one spot!  1) Overpriced...2 eggs, toast &  sausage for my mom and I had a pumpkin waffle for a total bill of $22 + oh we did have coffee too. That seems like a lot to me.  2) The food was cold and the waitress never came by to ask how it was so we could not tell her about it.  What was worse was that she was "training" some new girl.  Good luck with that.  3) When we flagged her down to comment on the cold food we were 75% finished so what was the point.  I saw her talk to the manager about it, but nothing was done.  She offered to replace it, but I don't want more cold food.  4) When we left the manager who was told about our cold food was the one who checked us out, never asked how it was since he didn't want to hear about the complaint...can you say "CHICKEN SHIT?"  Save your self some money and headaches and just go to Denny's get twice as much food for half the $$...

UWvEcKllzIdCzJI49Vq3Dg.text: Really good food and service.a bit pricey for breakfast tho..cost me 17.00 with tip..but I will definitely go back.

9DlxgWGFuV2FO64fkqDZNw.text: Great place for breakfast! My boyfriend and I came here on a Sunday morning expecting to wait forever (like any other breakfast place on a sunday morning), but we were surprised when the owner said it was a 10 minute wait. The entire time I was thinking "NO WAY" since there were a lot of people ahead of us. Surprisingly we were seated in ~10 minutes. Food got to our table quick and prompt. Our waitress was wonderful and the food was delicious!

k2qFvDxoQO4J2PAAlVNeOw.text: Protein pancakes were the best pancakes I've ever had. Went with the half and half and combined them with the veggie skillet. Great service and restaurant.

vJ5bzPE8E1RNXCDMl9aGMQ.text: The Restaurant manager is rude. My husband and his brother walked into the restaurant first. They were completely ignored. The manager was standing at the podium and looked right at them then just looked away. He only acknowledged me once I walked in.   When we received our food it was luck warm, not cooked all the way. We sent the food back to be cooked more, nothing like see-through, pink, greasy bacon! Yum! When the food returned, it was not much better. The table did not have any condiments, our waitress was nowhere to be found and I had to get them from another table. At no time did we receive an apolgy or visit from the manager for being unhappy with the food.   When we received our bill, I was quite surprised that we were charged $8 for coffee.   Upon leaving the restaurant, my husband and his brother were ignored again. The manager only said thank you to me.   Last time we will be dining there, which is unforunate because we were regular customers.

ulnccwqUt7TSobLIQXt0mA.text: The best place to eat breakfast a have had period. Try the protein pancakes. Great serves too. We go here every time we are in Scottsdale.

0SIHsPaaulCEHo96lMGd4g.text: My partner and I were in the area and I used YELP to help me find a Great breakfast place, or at least that's what I thought.  This place was mediocre at best.  I'm not a food snob by any means, but I just do not think this place deserves 4 stars. I've had fantastic breakfasts in cheaper places.  These Yelp ratings are a little disappointing, as it seems like almost every place has 4 stars, unfortunately we all know not all restaurants are fantastic.  Anyway, we both wished we'd gone to Denny's instead.

Dzox6KzbtaFRfsxSV-529w.text: Food was good , service was great there were 14 of us with kids and our waitress was very patient. She had another waitress coming by too to help they were great on service ..food was extremely better than ihop or Denny's . I had chicken fried steak n eggs n it was delish it's great for breakfast for out of towners like us!

-uWDrpgUntUhZ1JpdQ0N3g.text: I love breakfast foods. It's easy to make pancakes, eggs, and bacon at home, but it's fun to go out every once in a while and get something different. I love their whole wheat pancakes. I got strawberry pancakes with eggs and bacon with orange juice. The strawberries were delicious, and they topped the pancakes with lots of whipped cream. Amazing. They also have protein pancakes.  My boyfriend did mention that the coffee wasn't great, but compared to a similar breakfast restaurant (ahem, The Good Egg), it wasn't good there, either. So he didn't hold it against them. He had blueberry pancakes with eggs and bacon and he loved it. Even so far as to say that the food was better, albeit more expensive at U.S. Egg.  Also, for a Saturday morning/early afternoon, we were seated right away and our food came out super quickly. All around great service as well.  I will always come back, but not as often as I'd like because our bill was $24. Ouch! Only giving it 4/5 stars because it's more expensive than the competitors. If I could, I'd give it 4.5! :)

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. YUM!

veP8XZWiRDZDKIedTrsQLg.text: My wife and I arrived for breakfast at about 8AM. The service started off fine.  We ordered our food and it came out in about 2 minutes, eggs over medium with ham and I got the breakfast burrito.  Great, but it made us wonder if it was pre-made, sitting under a heat lamp.  Then we got the answer.  My wife's eggs over medium were over cooked.  One egg yolk was solid, no run.  We asked for the eggs to be made again.  Once again the eggs came out in less then 2 minutes and they were the same, over cooked.  My wife asked for them to be taken away.  The bill came and there was no discount for the poorly cooked eggs.  When I noted this to the waitress, she said she thought the Manager had taken it off.  The Manager then came over and said she would take $2.50 off for the eggs my wife didn't like.  The waitress was then very surly and was tipped accordingly.   I think they pre-make a lot of food to get ready for the rush.  We are never going to this US Egg again.

MTYfsQ51dqihAsaZv5OQdQ.text: My food was fine.  My husband ordered ala cart and the waitress came back to ask if he wanted fruit, or something else because it dame with it.  He said no because he didnt want it, then we see the bill and she put down a mwal that was close to what he ordered but $3 more.  Didnt have time to argue about as we had somewhere to be so tgat was part of her tip.  Why dont servers do what you ask?

_8_lv3eiu10juu9TgLjNdA.text: I have been going for years and have been to all of the locations and I only have the protein pancakes...I have gone with people that got other food and they said it was great so I am taking their word for it, but I am sticking to the PP!  I get 2 and take one home to eat for a later meal.  I wish I knew how many calories were in one but aside from that, I will be a devoted follower!

M9Ywce4SSZjHSehiJav40w.text: I always get the names of US Egg and The Good Egg mixed up. The food, however, is not to be confused. US Egg is a step above the quickly served breakfast diner style of Good Egg. If you go on weekend, expect a wait. They have a pretty quick turnover, so it's nothing painful. US Egg is filled with a mix of families and Scottsdale-ites decked out in oversized sunglasses and dresses and affliction t-shirts from the night before.   I wish I lived closer so I could visit more often and enjoy those famous protein pancakes. I was expecting healthy with an element of bland and chalky... completely wrong. They have a great grainy texture and a delicious cinnamon flavor.

HtULLUWzbgKsYbLu6d1otA.text: Protein pancakes are pretty much the best reason to go here. The rest of the stuff (eggs, hash browns, bacon, etc) is just so-so.

nJnw2YltOgbBcZs3Bzg8Kw.text: I've been a couple times now, and is always good. Very busy though. So expect a wait, but definitely a great place to go for breakfast or brunch.

sC5uIGitrEfU2Jxt7vSDfw.text: The US Egg is my weekend breakfast stop. It's a rare weekend that I don't eat there at least once. My go-to breakfast would be a half order of protein pancakes (a full order is two pancakes and they're HUGE) with bananas and blueberries and a side order of scrambled eggs. I'm also a big fan of the breakfast burrito (without meat). It comes with eggs, potatoes, veggies, cheese and salsa. It's big enough to split into two meals, or to share with your friends. In fact, most of the meals at US Egg are large enough to share, and at a cost of $0.99 an egg, I like to add a side of scrambled eggs to make sure everyone leaves with a full belly!  One potential mis-step is that their menu appears to limit the available options. Most meals can be completely customized (sub meat for veggies, sub chicken for sausage, etc...). The possibilities are endless.  There's also a great patio which is perfect on a quiet Sunday morning when cars aren't speeding down Scottsdale Road yet.

SAHwVyynBxTycrTTvNaUpA.text: Well a breakfast restaurant should have cracked eggs. Bagged eggs just don't make it.  No buttermilk pancakes is a second strike.  No maple syrup at any price is strike three you're out.   Even Denny's uses cracked eggs!

eOJVWCWYBoiM31hRrQovHQ.text: A little overrated. Service is excellent and friendly but food is ordinary. We tried eggs Benedict, Florentine, Denver omelette and a traditional breakfast.  Everything was a tad overdone and only lukewarm.  A shame because our server was really nice and welcoming.

dzRtUf7EfDqYfuPlKA5S4A.text: Very nice atmosphere, wait staff was outstanding, food was excellent, overall a wonderful experience. Would love to comeback someday.

lcITWrYNJm9h8idWcnHrKw.text: Probably  some kind of chain restaurant, walked into this place and it was so loud you couldn't  hear yourself think ! It was very busy,coffee was horrible  there hashbrowns were soggy and the sausage  was cold ! Places  like this I don't  undstand why people  like ? Maybe because they have big portions ? We wete on vacation  and went bye recommendation,  terrible  place.

3y0lm7lgqrxf9ZrZluyN-Q.text: Great place never disappoints , music ,people , like being at home for breakfast !!!!!!!

eUS8_yzIJz-LO4zQwmIa5Q.text: Good service, good food, inexpensive and typical American breakfast fare.  Come here if you want fast service with a smile and predictable food.  I had the omelette with green chili.  I can't complain about a thing other than I did send every glass and cup on the table back to the dishwasher because they were gross.  Ask for 'to go' cups for your coffee and OJ.

3a_xA0yX2MeZoCZwlKwYjg.text: Great ambiance. Good food.  Some times you feel like, if you could have double the tummy you could order the same dish and have it again and again. The best pan cakes. The best veggie burger.

ibyy1vZCMurMm0Q9rv13SQ.text: Gross... overpriced breakfast. $27 for two people! Nothing tasted very good. My omelette was super dry. My husband got a bonus egg shell in his salad. A manager was supposed to come talk to us about it... Never saw them. It was removed from the bill so it would have been over $30 for gross breakfast. It took a long time to get our good too.  Host was unfriendly. Waitress was sweet.

DYGumlvQZtAm7LJl5Wyckw.text: Great service, great food. We're visiting from Vegas, I stopped in, great choice. Thanks US Egg for great grub !! Love the USA Flag in the restaurant!!!! Enjoyed seeing our great men and women having a good meal @ the US Egg !!

9p4ZUIytFF9McdiQw3JHPA.text: Had family here for breakfast. Medium over eggs were all over cooked. The hash browns were soggy. 6 of us barely ate. Told waitress and was charged full price. Not happy with this place. Chef needs to know what over medium eggs are. And how hash browns should be cooked.

AlOpM19_9pb3bgFAIYgy0Q.text: The first time I went here it was great! This time no so much. I ordered a veggie skillet and it came out with sausage. They took it back and I thought they made me a new one but they actually just picked the sausage out but forgot one. I was disgusted. I'm sure that's against health code to pick in someone's food and take it back out to them.

a7A-BgnI1B2EeP3YgACI_A.text: Four of us went there for breakfast on Saturday morning.  The business was busy but not crazy and we were sat within 15 minutes.  The menu looked great but here comes the review.  We ordered two Idaho skillets, one omelette and a French dip.  Skillet 1 was acceptable if you don't mind that US Egg's version  of melted cheese, which means you have to search for it.  I did find some.  The 'hash browns' were shredded potatoes that most likely were microwaved then thrown on the grill for 30-60 seconds.  Hardly what is considered hashbrowns.   Over all it was OK but hardly anything to order again.  Skillet 2 came out with the wrong style eggs, OK, that can happen to anybody and was quickly remedied by the waitress.  It was passable with the same 'hashbrowns' and dry chicken.  Again, not something worth ordering again.  Omelette was an interesting omelette of which I can do far better at home on.   The entire leafs of spinach were essentially folded into what can best be described as scrambled eggs.   Could just be US Egg has their own version of omelettes also.  Same story on the 'hashbrowns.'  French dip came with au jus which is definitely required.  The roast beef was extremely dry and the bun likely a day old and dry also to where you needed the au just for both.  We didn't follow up with a manager as we were hungry and figured it was just a lesson learned.   We're located in the valley and are in this part of Scottsdale frequently  and now have been able to cross this breakfast establishment off our list.  FYI there is a Denny's across the street that might just do better.

MHgNuTZvHVXw4UNeNfkbYQ.text: The coffee pitcher on the table is a key at this chain. Somehow though, the coffee in the pot was lukewarm after 15 minutes. I tried the protein waffle and it needed more items inside to help it along - it seems like they skimped and I had to rely heavily on the syrup and butter to get through the dense waffle. Another person had a run of the mill omelette and standard hash browns. The construction is making parking and getting to the place a mess, so keep driving to Old Town to find better and more creative choices.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Good time
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dense

mDNQbRFaQjVvBEtQe7YCkQ.text: Food is amazing but service is mediocre. But it's a great place! Go try it out!! Their skillets are all so good!

yARqFvXgufXoKsykyobTjw.text: US Egg has become my parent's and my favorite breakfast place on our annual pilgramage to Phoenix to visit family. Our trip is not complete without at least one visit to this spot. The service is always great, as is the food. I am not usually a sweet breakfast person, but the Protein Pancakes are too good to pass up. I love that they offer the Half and Half, which includes a small order of the protein pancakes and a half skillet. Perfect for satisfying the sweet and salty cravings. The coffee is decent, which is all I ask for in a no frills breakfast spot. There is a large parking lot at this location, although it can get a bit crowded at peak breakfast time. If you are looking for a good, hearty breakfast or lunch, check this place out, it won't disappoint.

G6S8dIHsPqBiDlTruu4Vdg.text: This may seem like a better version of Denny's or IHOP, but US EGG stands alone! After you eat here you will understand. I'm super picky, and enjoy the finer things in life.  I went here on a layover several months ago and am now back! This is a beacon of breakfast food(never tried lunch here). I order an Idaho hash ( eggs, avocado, hash browns, bacon, chicken, tomatoes, onions and cheese along with a side of their famous protein pancakes) So, SO, So good! Just try it!

1ZV2Nh4hwNnrm1RM3Zz-Ng.text: My California Benedict was nothing but phenomenal. My mouth watered and my tongue loved every second. My taste buds were elated as the flavor of the bacon and the egg juices flowed down my throat. I left satisfied and filled.

KVhJpb5hG7kBnrYiCxD-4Q.text: This is my go-to breakfast spot!  We've never had to wait for a table, which is definitely nice when you're looking for your first meal of the day.  The menu is large and includes both breakfast and lunch items.  I love that if you order water or iced tea, they bring a pitcher to your table.  The service has always been friendly and despite how large of a restaurant it is, we have never had to wait a long time for our food to come out.

IWIwH6nZEUVRJbc4vtigkw.text: I was surprised at how big and open this place actually is, the outside is deceptively small! Great brunch place, good customer service. I went for the first time last weekend and it was a nice, chill Sunday afternoon. Looked to be a kid and adult friendly menu. Their Bloody Marys are effective. :)

wf27CT-I582abonmpp-Q8Q.text: Mmm mmm mmmm! The flavour and freshness is unbeatable... Denny's ain't got s**t on this place. The masters of Breakfast I would say. Great creations and incredible taste. Service prompt and attentive staff. The restaurant provides complimentary coffee outside while you wait, which was a nice little bonus. Protein pancakes were Delish! I actually finished my entire plate. Totally recommend doing the combo where u get a smaller skillet with pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half n half order

kQ1qVL9qMHRtFuVxFqXLOg.text: Restaurant is very clean and nice. Service is exceptional. The food was good, tons of choices.  Probably not as healthy as they imply. Protein pancakes is really a carb pancake. The scrambles are good. I would be willing to bet that most of their food is canned and then cooked for your order.

gJ3NeRcZ_XMd5wqO6aW5Ww.text: Had breakfast here yesterday and our waitress was just as pleasant as the first.  Outstanding  customer service, great food, good times

E7WR3ipVsm_d8Dya7Sx7lg.text: Great food and service. The half and half is perfect. You get a skillet and 2 protein pancakes. Highly recommended. They have flavored creamer for the coffee.... thumbs up

n773BeTcc4CfjgG81Tt-IA.text: Try the protein pancakes! So good. I was expecting them to get their name from having protein powder or meat in them, but I was excited to hear they are packed with blueberries, granola, and other tasty ingredients. The wait for a table was short, the staff was very attentive, and the food was delicious.

QylbVwf_QrMn7AzqtJtJoQ.text: It's exactly what you expect. The food is quality and predictable. The staff is friendly and checks in with you regularly. During Spring training they exceed service expectations. The patio seating is a nice touch.

TH1WoNqYPsK2ILcjeBsbug.text: What great place to come for a quick breakfast!  I must admit when we pulled up I saw few people waiting outside and thought and told my husband that I didn't want to go in cause there looks like a line.  But he convinced me that we should just go in.    We walked in and the hostess told us it would be 5-10 minutes I surprised how fast they seated us.  There was soo much to choose from on the menu, but I am such a simple girl I just wanted to egg, bacon, and potatoes, and that's what I got! And the Decaf wasn't too bad either!  The real reason why I chose to eat here was because I read Gabi M's review who is the community manager of Scottsdale/PHX area.  The funniest thing is that just as we got our coffee a guy walked by and I noticed that it was Gabi's husband, then who should be walking behind him GABI!!! Loved that! always great to see you Gabi!!! Thanks for your review!  Great place!

aQ8KsLlX70qwANSZzRgK6A.text: Large dinner style breakfast joint. Best eggs Benedict in town. Pretty normal price 10-12 per breakfast.

R_gilGqbDtlvBC9NHh86YQ.text: After NYE hungover breakfast....PERFECT! Lots of food, good service, value in pricing. Had the 1/2 meat skillet with protein pancakes...SOLID!

Rgej670VBfbmSYM2TF4x0g.text: Been coming to this restaurant since 1995 when opened in Tempe.  Had the half and half w the ham skillet.  Protein pancakes were good.  Skillet was awful.  Hash Browns were luke warm at best, meat in skillet was sorta warm.  Over easy egg was medium.  Last rwo visits to you guys have been away from Tempe and very subpar.  I guess I will omly go to Tempe location and since its 35 miles from my house, not too often now.  Sad to have to write this but you guys need to step up the game.

Yi7G7dG7AL2bLwWyzpqeKg.text: Fast service. Great food. Clean. Good prices. And they have alcohol! What more could you ask for :) I will definitely be back! Glad to find a great breakfast place so close to my house!

mSqR24h_nKXyMhwtWSih3Q.text: Horrible service and gross food. We walked in and the manager barely greeted is. He was to busy talking to some server half his age. The waitresses are young and to busy with gossip to serve you. The food for the price is ridiculous.  I did try to like the food here.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The ticket for gross food and horible service.

iR5ObpGP-mrROoiSVR8Q3Q.text: This place is just alright.  Prior to my sister's graduation, we stopped at US Egg, so my sister can grab breakfast with her classmates. When we were seated, there was still a pitcher of water, from the previous party, along with some trash that sat there for a good 10 minutes, before someone cleaned it off.  Not long after the table was cleaned off, our waitress quickly got our drinks and food ordered. But, when the food was delivered, the main server directed the other server to put a plate of food in front of mom, but she gives it to my dad instead and just walked away, leaving our poor waitress to make the switch.  Food portions are huge, so well worth your bang for your buck. I loved my cornbeef and hash dish. Unfortunately, a few of the staff's customer service skills could use some improvement.

mNDLZnf_na2SMzLvt_NlLw.text: We stopped in for breakfast, and had the chicken fried steak.  The menu had a lot to choose from and the restaurant was spacious.  Parking is readily available.  A good family restaurant.  The service was quick.

pgteAJvKBpcg5WNsJVRdJg.text: Great food, great service. Visiting from Palm Springs, CA. Loved the protein pancakes with the skillet. Perfect amount of food to start the day! U.S.EGG!

bfoozc1E2prT-l1sd9qSQA.text: U.S. Egg. I've taken people here who I loved. I've taken people here who I didn't like very much. I've met people here at 7 a.m. ish for a ride home after a night of drinking and having passed out inside a friend's hotel room.  The food is just a teensy bit better than standard breakfast fare.  The portions are large.  But the part I love about U.S. Egg is the consistently friendly service.  In fact, one morning a server insisted on buying one of her regulars breakfast.  I eaves-dropped on the entire conversation because 1.) I am nosy and 2.) I was fascinated.    I do love their turkey sausage here for some reason.  But the real reason I come to U.S. Egg is its location.  It is the best place to go when I am on my way OUT of Old Town.    U.S. Egg, I will be seeing you soon!

uEl6-y5LLFKVEXD9MGkMrQ.text: Food was good, service not so good. Was happy they had biscuits.  Didn't have to wait,   which is great, but do think they need to understand customer service better.

wlHhrHiSOOW682D_ZJEwZA.text: Came here for breakfast before my flight to SFO and all the raving I've read on here is completely TRUE.  I got the Half & Half breakfast with the protein pancakes it comes with a scramble as well, more than enough food for two to share and cheap prices.  Loved the quick service and nice staff, I didn't have any problems with them like I read from some others so perhaps they resolved all the issues.  I would definitely recommend this place and visit again the next time I'm in the Scottsdale area.

RU0-JGjsuP2lK7ffmxZaVw.text: First of all, let me say, my wife and I love this place.  It's our local go-to spot for breakfast or brunch.  However, if you go anytime before 11am, expect to wait a solid 15 minutes or so for a table.  They're busy, because they're popular, but they also staff the restaurant well, so the wait isn't as long as it could be if it weren't staffed as well.  The servers aren't overly friendly or conversational, but I think that goes back to the fact that they are so busy in the mornings.  I give them a pass because the food and prices are so legit.  Without fail, my wife and I always order the Protein Pancakes with a side of eggs.  We don't typically get into ruts like that, because we like to try new things, but you CAN'T beat these pancakes!  Try them.  You're welcome.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Arizona Fritada with half order of Protein Pancakes

GNGlJf9vcDKWCE_cr24TXw.text: Neat little diner.  Great signs, decent service.  Kind of a weird crowd inside but it's a breakfast place so what do you expect.  The egg dishes are great as you would expect...my son of course got the pancakes with granola (signature), which is a creative and VERY filling dish.  well priced and nice, well-lit ambience.  I wouldn't expressly go out of my way to go here but it's a cool little joint that if I lived in the area I would probably hit a few times a week.

cDYq-8PlJL7203RUL-4p8A.text: We have eaten breakfast the last couple of mornings at this location of U S Egg and we have been very impressed.  My  Husband got the ham and cheese omelet - with wheat toast. We love the wheat toast we get in Arizona - better than in the South. He really enjoys the omelets.  I am an iced tea drinker and they bring me a pitcher of tea along with my husbands pot of hot coffee and an entire pitcher of ice water!!!! It is great. I got the whole grain pancakes with delicious blue berries! This is a great way to start the day.

pfqPVc-x8Gh1IAYP8I9umg.text: Pretty disappointing. I've been going to the US Egg in Tempe and Scottsdale for years.    I'm not sure if I caught Scottsdale on a bad day or not but this weeks experience was awful. Genuinely unfriendly hostess, mediocre service and I had to send back the food (something I've done less than three times in my life).  I really doubt I'll be back...

atQSFDrjhlYVGtXLv3cSmA.text: Best Chicken n' Waffles I've ever had!  I get it with eggs sunny side up.  I let the yoke run wild to complement the protein waffle, fried chicken, ketchup, syrup, hot sauce and the dish turns into one conglomerate of deliciousness.  Probably not the healthiest thing in the world, but the mixture is incredible!  I don't know anything about the drinks because I get water so I don't get a heart-attack from this sugar and good cholesterol overload.  I don't eat anything after this for another 6 or 7 hours.

Lj0Kvp_QaUVlOKggZAoU-A.text: It's packing but you can still get in quickly which is a good thing if there are 6 of you and you are hungry.  Pretty standard fare but it is reasonably priced and they get it to the table pretty darn quick.  Will say they do make some significantly large enough pancakes.  I suggest the blueberry ones - YUM!  And they will keep the juices, water, and coffee coming as long as you want them.  Even though we like trying new places to eat when we travel we seem to gravitate to this place each time we are in Scottsdale.

Mvc_DaHJhyyvP0dHv-rkNQ.text: I am a big fan of this place. I love their consistency. It's nice that the owners recognize you, shake your hand, and thank you for coming in. Weekend mornings look like there will be a long wait but they are very efficient, even with 30 people outside it normally doesn't take more than 10-15 minutes to be sat. The food comes out quickly as well so it's always a pleasant experience.  I recommend the 1/2 and 1/2 with a scramble and protein pancakes. Hits the spot every time and plenty of food to leave full.

6w1WiMgwB7rhrudZxDI2bA.text: Protein Pancakes are Incredible. This is a multi location family owned restaurant that always treats us great. The food is consistently delicious. No matter what you order you really cant go wrong.

67ZQKkK2QSosXizEw9h6VA.text: Seriously, Spring Training would be nothing without US Egg. Located just a few blocks from Scottsdale Stadium (Home of the two time San Francisco Giants.. ahem), this place is a must-go before an afternoon game.   Why is US Egg so special? Well, even though there is a wait, you get FREE coffee? There is a private parking lot so no need to stress about parking either.   The food is awesome. Try the half and half - two protein pancakes (delish pancakes with slivers of almonds, oatmeal, and blueberries - SUPER FOODS!), and a skillet of your choosing. Skillets can come with bacon, chorizo, peppers, onions, you name it. And they are topped with a fried egg. Yes, yes, a thousand times yes.   Service is excellent and fast. Water is in a pitcher on your table so you don't have to wait for refills. As is coffee.  What else do you need?

zo8pP_zesixQJjReYvPp7w.text: A great place for breakfast!  The blueberry pancakes are so light and tasty!  Incredible!  Will definitely go there again!

B0JewHAz3G_ZztbiIZvZtw.text: Food cold eggs overdone plus it is expensive for breakfast. I would not recommend this place.

9OOIi79h4VI_MHiXsIUf2w.text: Love this place!  The chicken and waffles are better and cheaper than LOLOS (which is just down the street).   Disappointed I couldn't substitute my eggs for another waffle or anything, but that's just how life works, I guess.   The food is delicious.  The prices are decent.  The service wasn't bad.    4 stars!

TW3SSs4sNU-c2rIzAFoqKw.text: After a super early flight into Phoenix, our party of 16 was quite hungry. I've read about the hype of U.S. Egg, but had to have a taste of it myself.  The verdict is in and this place is for real.    They have a very large menu and everyone in the party seemed to like what they got.  The biggest surprise was the bloody mary's were freaking excellent.  The waitress didn't miss a beat with our large party.  Food came out quickly and warm.  Overall, great experience.  PROS:  Beautiful waitresses Bloody Mary's Customer Service  Cons: Bathroom ran out of paper towels

6QxOZlouj_f0EaXqUR6hHg.text: Well done Oscar. You do an awesome meal 12 years later from the first time I met you and the boys at the Tempe location. Your menu has always been a finer quality before anyone even knew better. I was in the area and had to stop in to see who was working. My meal was superb and my service excellent. You and the crew always give me the best. Thank You.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WA63v2FwhxLyig_7ing6eQ.text: My husband and I went to U.S. Egg this morning after reading online that they served gluten-free toast from a gluten-free toaster.  As a celiac sufferer I get excited about little things like being able to eat toast in restaurants!    This place is a gem, and not only for people who have to eat gluten-free.  The interior is clean and bright and cheerful, and the staff could not be more friendly or efficient.  Ashley waited on us and she was a peach!  We both had omelettes, which were fluffy and delicious, with tasty fillings.  I can always tell a good omelette when the cook takes the time to saute and soften the vegetables before filling the omelette.  The hash browns were wonderful and crispy without the slightest bit of grease, and, of course, the toast was great.    I almost forgot to mention, but the coffee was excellent.  All in all, it was a great experience and we will definitely return.

8WsXMuC_XYh7PBMAoJvixQ.text: Been bringing the family here since they opened. Great family business and best protein pancakes around! I recommend the half-n-half with the protein pancakes and chicken-avocado!

ENOI7Gpw5C---a9UIcUacQ.text: Had breakfast here after staying across the street. Service is wonderful and staff is nice!! I had an omelet that was decent but the filling should have been more sauteed. Overall the food and service is great!!

X3Kj4qPcHNyijL5VjRjIqg.text: Clean restaurant,  Decent food.  Nothing special.  Nothing bad.  Veggie scramble was hot, predictable and fast-to-the-table.  WAAAY too much iced tea - asked for a glass of iced tea, lots of ice, got a pitcher.  Felt compelled to drink a lot of it, just because it was there.    Service was good, but this place is franchisey-ish and not really memorable.

5Uub8Ktf0-CbVUg5-2gYqg.text: Looked for a breakfast place and found this establishment close by. We were seated right away and the waitress quickly stopped by to accommodate our drinks.  Ordered the garden (veggie) omelet and a turkey sandwich, both came out very fast although neither of them were all too special. Sandwich came out dry  barely having any mayo and the omelet was meh.  All and all quick service,  decent prices and food is ok.

wAIW71N_zKOJVSkX7bwO8w.text: About as good as a  breakfast place can get.  Good food, good service, clean and friendly atmosphere.  I will most definitely visit again next time I am in Scottsdale.

MOTT9Az14oy9oXSQJs1f0g.text: Protein pancakes were a disappointment. There has got to be better places to eat breakfast in town. Made a bad choice with the huevos rancheros. Beans and chili out of a can almost certainly.   Atmosphere was very old, guess it's good for families. Service was good but overall pretty meh if you're looking for something special.

95IrmeLhyEvGxDkHrVL_Cw.text: The protein pancake was good as were the scrambled eggs. The hash browns were not cooked enough. The coffee was okay. Overall, I would say a good place for breakfast but not great.

yNbzBg1DuIaGcg3nmjS5ow.text: Love coming here. The service is always good, the menu has standard and adventurous items and they don't judge you if you're clearly hung over. I'd recommend to friends.

vmpsh8OjqIo1gMlP00QyuA.text: Really did like my food, but wish the portion sizes were slightly smaller and the price could reflect that. It ended up being really expensive for 2 people. Great mimosas though, those were a great price! I'd eat here again if I had more money

yhUI6S07xKdtnqEnfLaxdg.text: Terrible service all around.  We called ahead and were told 5 mins.  Waited for 30+.  Food was pretty gross and we had to have food sent back multiple times and the manager was trying to make excuses about how hard it is to poach an egg.  Avoid!

EJ1s-rBSdeMPyJv3rsltrQ.text: Best breakfast  food ever. The protein pancakes are insanely good- and even healthy!  That's a nearly impossible task for pancakes- but they pull it off.    Service is outstanding. The servers and owner always greet you with a smile. I always put in a difficult order- with substitutions and somehow they always seem to get it right!    For those of you that don't recognize quality or want something unhealthy and greasy- there's a Denny's across the street! LOL

pl7z9l00kWA8CFnAdlxRFw.text: Other breakfast places take note :  If you are having a busy day (father's day) and a person who comes in by themselves asks for coffee:  " Just give them a pot"  I like how I was able to enjoy my breakfast and wash it down with coffee along the way, the hostess definitely came back to check on me but freed up plenty of time to take care of other larger tables that may have required more assistance ( I can appreciate the weighting associate with priorities )   She made great suggestions for what to have and I went with the skillet and pancakes, I know a lot of people rave about these in the reviews but I'm going to just say my two cents:  - the pancake was a little dry and not all that fluffy - the random bits of grain made the pancake inconsistent  - you definitely arnt getting a healthy option when you add in the butter and syrup.  Definitely not the worst tasting pancake but it just got way too built up in other reviews , thought I would set the record straight.  The skillet was amazing though so I would definitely recommend trying the chicken avocado bacon skillet and the pancake but not have this built up idea about how life changing those pancakes will be, overall great experience, will have to come back for the omelette   Also: love how they offered me coffee to go after I basically murdered that whole pot of coffee.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I consumed everything !!!

tZPjdxN3NZJCBmjC6YBQCQ.text: Great service, good service and fantastic food. I am a picky eater and always request my meals a specific way, which typically gets lost in the translation.  Not here, they nailed it.  Best breakfast ever.

bm6h137dc486_tYM0hsdOg.text: Stopped in for a late breakfast while visiting Scottsdale.  There was a wait, that's usually a good sign the food is worth it.  Took about 15 minutes to get a table, not bad at all.  Service was very attentive.  I had Eggs Benedict with hash browns.  It was really good, exactly what I wanted.  My daughter had waffles with well-done bacon. She was also very pleased.  Food was warm, satisfying portions, a lot of variety on the menu. Has a diner/cafe feel and sound. Much better than the expensive foofy restaurant at our hotel.  I'll go back for sure when in town.

vD_XZ-6kNnYwFJDmfWW8iQ.text: PROTEIN PANCAKES. That's all you need to know. You can thank me later.  Also pictured: eggs with cheese, sausage, grits, California benedict :)  And very friendly service. But seriously...protein pancakes. What are you waiting for!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

H6HOHNbrVvmj3jWQstkVUg.text: Food we ordered didn't come, they could have cared less. Slow kitchen. The rye toast was the best part. Bacon was burnt. Just not impresses with this place. Would not recommend.

jdfBclsWbQ2f2bQes-Tacw.text: I had what I thought was a lovely omelet. About half way through I bite into something foreign and gross looking, a little over an inch square. . The waitress sends over the owner/manager and he tells me it's an avocado skin and not to worry, it simply was knocked into my food as they were prepping other things.  I started worrying what else could be in my food. When we received the bill I looked for an adjustment to the bill since I didn't and couldn't complete my meal. None. The waitress said the managers told her she couldn't discount it per instructions of the owner. I will not be back.

nY3lyIZEGtnOL1ZKqLUpoA.text: I'm still going back all of the time and I tried a couple of different things but have returned to and settled on my banana pancake and eggs breakfast -- I get the Jr Triple Play which is half the size of the regular so I have them add one egg   It works out perfectly and is cheaper.  Two sausage, 2 eggs (after I add one) and a single pancake.  Perfect.    ONE NOTE: they use fake butter so you have to request real butter if you don't want to eat nasty chemical margarine.  Unfortunately their margarine is pretty good, but note that it is still fake butter.  That's a bit of a disappointment in my second favorite place -- but they stay busy so apparently most people do t notice or care.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wCu2w9RyEVQpF8hV-Yh1wQ.text: Awesome breakfast / brunch place, right across the street from my hotel.  They were busy, but I got seated within a couple minutes. VERY friendly staff...!  Extensive menu, including high protein & gluten free selections. I had the west coast omelette, with grilled broccoli, and it was outstanding.  Looking forward to my next visit here.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. West coast omelette, with grilled broccoli.

ECL1ohqoEpJf4RdL3GGCaw.text: Double boo for this place. I've been coming here since they only had 1 place on Mill and the dad ran it. Back then it was an awesome fun and tastey place to get a great bite to eat. Now it tastes and feels like corporate America. I couldn't be more disappointed.  I guess I'm giving them 2 stars for the memories.  But honestly this place might as well be the Dennys across the street. The food is now bland and the quality is mediocre at best. The fruit was old. Maybe frozen and not fresh anymore?  Service took a hit too. I'm in business. So I get it. Profits... But at what cost. Go back to your old ways.... I guess with the corporations taking over Scottsdale I was hoping this place would always be the same. Obviously I was wrong.

ONwqXYxGyhuwvJIIscCdZA.text: This is one of the best brunch places! Hardly ever a long wait to be sat and the food is usually prepared quickly. Their protein pancake is one of the best things on the menu- it's huge but light and not too thick or not too sweet. They have fresh squeezed juice which you can definitely taste the difference. I've never had a bad experience here. The atmosphere is pleasant with quirky yet cohesive decorations. Coffee is super bold and they bring a nice sized pot too. The staff is always on point. The price is a little steep- but I'd say worth it over all. For anything comparable the price is good though!

ZbVSYa_PbNM5zCKVs6xzwQ.text: Great breakfast spot.  They have almond milk or skim for coffee. Winning!! lol. Grill their potatoes and have a friendly staff. When staying at the courtyard in old town this will be my pick to start the day.  I hear the protein pancakes are good but didn't get to try them. Large selection on there breakfast menu.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4Quit6IIQAHcaE_rF9zufQ.text: One of many good breakfast/brunch options in the Scottsdale area.  We were a group of 9 including children.  We were seated promptly and the waitress was patient with all the chaos associated with hungry young kids.  Coffee was served quickly and was above average; as were the juices.  Food arrived promptly.  The omelettes I sampled in our group were all flavorful and the pancakes were delicious.  Overall a good experience for hungry people.  Highly recommend a visit if you are in the mood for this type of food.

iEWPRffL-ED5xpx9WyjRdA.text: First off, if you are Gluten Free, this is the best menu selection I have seen for GF options! Everyone was very friendly, and the GF food was excellent. Had the California Eggs Benedict on GF toast. Benedict is one of my favorites, but couldn't have it at other restaurants because of the English muffin.  Staying at the Courtyard Scottsdale and US Egg is directly across the street. Tomorrow, the GF waffles or French toast! Great job US Egg.

yrUWTSi3u9wWpbeyJlOiow.text: Always a good bet with a huge menu for breakfast and lunch, warm and polite staff and the food... Superb!  Everything I've tried has been a cut above specialty morning joints and way far beyond any national chain.   We ordinarily go to the Shea Blvd & Scottsdale Rd location on way to the movies, Total Wine or after dropping our little Exotic female off at Lori's Grooming ~ all within a a block!  Very impressed and I recommend this location highly, being bright, spacious and having ample parking.  I especially like it's proximity to great shopping and the Fox Cigar Bar in Scottsdale.   Daniel Koskovick

wwr_ro3eA3_PQDECB_Zy8g.text: Food: 3.5, Service: 3.5, Atmosphere: 4 Cost to worth it rating: 3 (most special breakfast items like benedits or half and half $12) Opentableable: no, kid's menu: yes (with coloring) Return worthiness: sure  Highlights: - Large menu: from omelettes to pancakes, skillets and lunch sandwiches, there a great variety. Portions were large too. - Decor: diner style with cool art pieces. Many egg cartons painted to look like the American flag (also a Pokestop). Also a big US map on one wall with pictures of iconic items from that state.  - Skillets: liked my chicken, chorizo, and green chile one. Loved mixing a sunnyside up egg with the hash browns and proteins. Hub got the insane meat lovers one which had chicken fried steak, sausage, ham, and bacon covered with white gravy. 4 stars  - Eggs benedict: looked a bit sad and hollandaise was borderline neon but taste was on point. 3.5 stars  - Pitcher of water: maybe they're used to dehydrated people in the desert but leaving one for us was greatly appreciated   Midlights: - Protein pancake: they're famous for this yet I didn't quite enjoy the granola nestled in the batter--it isn't as appealing lacking crunch. 3 stars  Lowlights: - Didn't realize they had a variety of mimosas until I saw the tent towards the end of our meal.  Solid casual place I'd come back to.

ip5CHUoUR0QxN9srkrxXJw.text: Well, sadly to say this was the worst experience I have had a U.S. Egg.  My coffee was COLD.  Like, stick your finger in it cold.  Great waiter!  Got my food bacon was COLD!  It all tasted good, but why was everything refrigerator cold?  I asked the waiter, he just wanted to replace everything.  I was so thoroughly disappointed.  When I got my Hot coffee, it was really good!

l2tG5uIAO5dykWrk7Q4gRw.text: Wish I could give this place 0 Stars. I got chicken tenders and fries..My chicken tenders were cooked too long, brown, and really tough. Some of my fries were charcoal black. My date got Philly sandwhich... It came with roast beef and not steak on it. The philly meat was really tough and dry. We left over 90% of our foodm The waitress didn't even ask us how it was. It was my first trip here...I will never, ever come back or recommend this place

5E34taALDuWPODYgnocnUg.text: Stopped in for breakfast and couldn't decide between the corned beef hash or Denver omelette, went with the Dever and wasn't disappointed, food came out hot and fast, lots of ham which was good and a good portion of hash browns. They dropped off a pot of coffee with the meal so never needed to ask for a refill. Waitress was nice and attentive which made for a positive dining experience

GK7R467lBqExmnMdakD22Q.text: This is a great breakfast spot with consistent quality food and service. The owners are always at the front and make you feel welcome. Eveything i have tried is good but i would say protein pancakes and the idaho skillet are must haves. Try the half and half to get both!

9gZG7qo-cnNL_9Su3Cq_zg.text: Great food!  In fact on our travels to Scottsdale we look forward to stoping in here and do multiple times. Prices are great and service is better. Thanks so much for not changing the way you do things over the past couple of years. When we come for spring training you are on our list to stop at multiple times.

N03SdqUG3ZhifiydYK33Kw.text: This was my second time eating here and both times I ate here it was during the weekend.   The place has been busy both times I was here. Inside is very bland and boring, I guess you could say it looks generic. We were seated fairly quickly given the 10 minute wait. Upon sitting down we noticed our glasses were dirty, this was the case the first time we ate here as well. Our sever was at our table to take our drink orders right away and she brought us clean glasses. The menu selection is big. The food quality is no better than Denny's and for more money. I love huevos rancheros and what they have here is not huevos rancheros, they use flour tortillas with the dish and it is overall bland. Same goes for the other dishes that my friends had, just bland. All the food came out luke warm but very fast. My friends over easy eggs were cooked thru. When my food came out I was given an English muffin with mold on it. The server immediately took the muffin away and brought another which was nice but received no apology from the manager. I wonder how many people ate muffins with mold on them.   Anyway, in a nutshell this place has questionable food quality and bland food to match the bland interior. But the service is quick and nice with easy parking.

7CzmzhYa_VzFG1xh5bBUiA.text: My brother and I are just visiting for two days on a road trip to CA and saw the reviews on yelp. It is a nice, pleasant breakfast atmosphere with kind servers and a cool wall mural. The food was great as well, and you definitely get your bang for your buck (a.k.a lots of food). The protein pancakes were excellent, just like the server suggested. Overall great place to wake up and eat in Scottsdale. Doesn't get a five star though because nothing really WOWED us, but it was good food.

JJf-7-JRafLCQIPa6KqeoA.text: I'm from the city (NYC that is) and when I walked in to US egg and saw the crowd and table placements I assumed I had walked in to iHop of Scottsdale but to my dismay I open the menu and read so many delicious and healthy meals I was hooked.  Despite the crowd I was sorted in less than 15 minutes.  Try the half & half! Loved it!!!

TM4neVmatsCtxdHtjJ3eHQ.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots. Great omlettes and breakfast choices. They also serve lunch which my wife always orders. Great staff and the owners are always present and helping with operations which is a cool touch in my opinion.

BjDjlDz0BgbNIHPMsottLA.text: I have to rave about this place....  Not only are the portions HUGE, but the food is absolutely delicious. The boyfriend and I split the Hawkeye omelette, which has chicken, avocado, bacon, and melty cheese all in  fluffy omelette pillow. Not only did this save us money, but we were still stuffed.   I can't wait to go back!

sKVGLYBG7ydgDdTNFFm4IQ.text: The food was good, but a little overcooked. Nothing was inedible though. I had the California Benedict. It was definitely tasty. My husband had the corned beef hash and enjoyed it. I also had a Bloody Mary and it was really good. It had a pickle and olive which I like way better than when it has celery. That's just my personal opinion though. The service was fast too. It was around $30 for the two of us. Not bad at all.

JnDSLAi9FCuH9FAQ72D2nw.text: Food here is less than mediocre..    My guess is that people come here just to get some food in their stomach.  Obviously it can't be for taste or the quality of the food.  The best part of breakfast was the coffee which was nice and strong.  My scrambled eggs were pretty bad and you can tell it was made from the carton stuff.  And the bacon??  It was cooked beyond recognition and broke into little pieces when I attempted to eat it.  No kidding..  The sausages were just OK, nothing spectacular.    Like I said, the coffee was good but it doesn't make up for the tasteless food and the STEEP prices.  I think we spent close to $25 for breakfast and the whole time I kept thinking we should have gone to Denny's across the street.

zpz4o_7IzJ7S1EHog6mT1Q.text: One of my gentleman friend's really likes this place and I trusted his opinion because he usually has a big.........appetite. Let me tell you this place is the BEES KNEES!!!  We were seated within two hot seconds and our food came as quick as it takes to dance the jitterbug. Holy cow was the food great! Omelets were the cats pajamas.. coffee was hot and rockin'. After being a boozehound at the local speakeasy last night this place definitely hit the spot!

iLLBvaaSNmQQPMS4QHy0lg.text: I've been there several times over the years but they seem to have copped an attitude. The other day I asked for bacon crispy. To me that means the fat is cooked through but not burnt. It came out uncooked. Today i asked for hash browns crisped up. They came out like over cooked shoe string potatoes. I pictured the cook upset at the request and producing this garbage. Add some poor service to boot and I am done with this place. Crappy tooth picks as well.

NOzt47Vv-B3qEPuQ8Cmgig.text: U.S. Egg seems to be the poor man's version of The Good Egg.  Similar decor, similar ambiance, similar menu, but the food just can't compare.  Mind you, it's not bad and beats the hell out of Denny's, but it's closer to a  2-star experience than a 4-star experience.  My eggs were overcooked,  the service was mediocre, and during spring training the place is packed with Giants fans (not the reason for the 2-star review, I'm just saying).

Kh4wfjWZ2GEzB8wQs9cUnw.text: The atmosphere was clean and bright, which I appreciate for a breakfast joint. I would say the food...well, it fell short. I ordered the blueberry pancakes, bacon, and fruit plate.   The pancakes were tasty but a little bland, even with syrup. The fruit plate looked a little old and the bacon was dry, perhaps baked instead of fried. Also, the food wasn't that hot, which was sort of gross.   Overall, I'd give it another shot and pick something else, but if it's still disappointing, I'd move on.

boxRVV7UUreBmjx81-d18Q.text: Stopped in for breakfast with Mike Couchie. Nice clean place good atmosphere. However my scrambled eggs were cold and over cooked. Mike easy over were over hard he complained and got two perfect eggs brought right over. I think this restaurant is just ok and I probably won't return, seems expensive for cold eggs.

05gdoKYoQF7W-L4_UWtWVw.text: Yummy yummy and yummy!  I was excited to see a variety of veggie options (besides pancakes).  I enjoyed the Veggie Benedict, very delicious.  My son enjoyed the "dollar pancakes" from the kids menu which are not dollar sized, they're normal sized pancakes and it comes with 3!  An absolute steal at only $4.99. My husband had the Denver omelette, he said it was pretty good not great, but not bad.  My mom enjoyed the Blueberry waffles, and she said they were amazing!  I liked that they had fresh blueberries on top, not just blueberry pie filling like you find at some places.  Prices are not cheap, but in my opinion very reasonable.  My only real complaint is the service was terrible.  We were in slightly before the rush, by the time we left there was a wait but none when we came in.  I was disappointed that our server couldn't keep drinks filled.  The topper was when she dumped creamer on our table and just brought extra napkins.  Didn't wipe it up, didn't even really apologize to my husband who she dumped it in front of. Luckily he got out of the way of wearing it.    We'll be back, but I really hope the service improves next time.

bmMTi9MzWZTmbFlYx5JKVA.text: Deelicious breakfast! Was my first visit here and definitely not my last. Had the Idaho veggie skillet and huevos rancheros and PROTEIN PANCAKES! Yummy :)) service was great too :) very friendly front staff!

0grKs7aFmVHr5y8VgrCnXg.text: I don't know why this place have 4 stars but I guess some people like their eggs, bread and pancakes served lukewarm...  For me, this place is best at 3 stars just to be nice.   I'm sorry for all those U.S egg fans out there but I take my breakfast seriously. My breakfast better be hot or you will get a very grump attitude from me! I thought hot breakfast should be a no brainer?? Unfortunately, I guess I have to request it to be hot and fresh out of the pan and not to expect that a place that serve solidly on breakfast should know any better. Oh I am sorry you don't serve solidly on breakfast?? Then you probably should take the word eggs out because you don't take your eggs seriously! Serve it hot or don't serve it at all!!!

_IAUv3XfK9R_X9E97elxrw.text: Eggs Benedict were just ok but the staff was very friendly and always refilled my drink

h891ECN_jkWXRd3UMaVIkQ.text: Food was very good with nice size portions.  Wait staff did a great job and owner walked the floor checking and keeping things in order.

wtTC6p7f6ucCC-VEiQWhZA.text: Delicious food with great service.  Anytime they drop a whole carafe of coffee on my table when I order a coffee, I know it's going to be a good day!  I ordered the pancakes which were whole wheat and delicious with a half order of a skillet that had chicken bacon and avocado and tomatoes.  Delicious!!  I also ordered a boiled egg and it was great too!!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside decor

rLQWvItIdp15kuYi3ZMOcw.text: You might not realize it, but U.S. Egg is kind of a mecca for people trying to live a healthy lifestyle and eat a high-protein diet.
