Yes, they have all the standard breakfast and brunch foods, but if you look at the back of the menu there is a section titled "Proteins" where they list protein pancakes, steak and eggs with a sliced tomato instead of hash browns, eggs with a hamburger patty, omelettes with bacon, salads with lettuce, meats, and cottage cheese, etc. There's even a gluten-free option and it all tastes really good!  Plus, every time I've eaten here, or at the location at Baseline and Mill, service has been great... prompt and with a smile. So if you're looking for a place to grab a quick breakfast or lunch, show your patriotism and head for U.S. Egg!

2zbmp3idV1QTgTaYsdaUvw.text: Every time we visit Scottsdale we visit this place. Great food and good service. We will def be back!

IWS6kWoVdEP4RrySuTwzIw.text: If you are looking for a restaurant with lots of choices this is the place.  Good quality food with large portions.  Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 1/2 and 1/2 chocolate chip pancakes with chicken avocado and tomato skillet.
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cornhusker breakfast
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fruit plate

89RcGhjxFGhPe2dmSh5i4g.text: So I guess they removed my last review.  Not sure why.  In my last review, I stated that we arrived just after 2:20 on a Sunday afternoon.  The front desk girl told us they were not seating any body else because they close at 2:30.  If you're going post everywhere your open until 2:30 then continue to seat people until 2:30.  My impression is that they lack service.  We went to another place nearby just north of there that remained open until 3.  Unlike US Egg, they were very nice and seemed happy when we walked through the door.  If you're going to not seat people until 2:30, then you should post it on your website.  Hopefully this doesn't get taken down as well.  I felt strongly enough about this that I took the time to write a second review.  Much better options around the area.

IGpkh22-_qX3QtJXzK5IXA.text: The food was delicious,  nice environment and right across from the hotel I was staying at.  The protein pancakes were amazing, never had then you didn't even need syrup. Their skillets ere also yummy the meat lovers one was spectacular.  Wish they were open for dinner I would come again.

e2-4NUmjF7DjPJfe8mf9cA.text: My go to breakfast spot!! Bring a friend and split the half-half so you get their delicious skillets ( I always add avocado and an extra egg if I'm sharing) and amazing protein pancakes. Their scrambled eggs and omelette are also delicious. You can't go wrong here.

b75e5_hWQOdeQjNT_nOIQw.text: Great Breakfast every time I come here!  Service very Good.  I got half and half today, 2 protein pancakes and a half avocado, tomato, bacon skillet.  It was very Good!  It's too much for me for one meal, it travels ok and heats up well.  You gotta try if you want a simple good well priced breakfast,  way better than those other National Chains whose names begin with a D or I.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. 1/2 and 1/2, 2 protein pancakes and a half avocado, tomato, bacon skillet.

3vwRCHUGrGmwlfNn8I8tFQ.text: U.S. Egg is a great place for breakfast and the protein cake is notable.  The other dishes are good, too, but the protein cake can only be gotten at this restaurant (as far as I know).  It is just delicious!  Another thing to know about U.S. Egg - there is often a line outside the door but do not let that dissuade you - it moves quickly and you won't wait long.  And of course, it's worth it!  Plenty of parking, too.

VWejQZuxB6mt-8OA0HlTHg.text: Stopped by last Sunday for breakfast and found the meal to be pretty good. I had the chili omelette, which came with potatoes and an english muffin. The whole dish was very good, and would return to try other things on the menu.

HoxUlaif1whEgZ0a1d8pzw.text: Met Alice Cooper here once.  Eat the crunchy granola pancakes.  Do not get two, you only need one.  One is bigger than your head.  Coffee is bottomless.  Not the best coffee I've had, but good for an egg joint.  For Scottsdale it's not an uppity place..just what you need for breakfast.  Fast, in and out in about 15 minutes and under $15.

wTjwmSw7VwFbyCzUi3B2FQ.text: Stopped in on a recommendation of a friend/family member. Nice building and nice ambiance. Good was in par with what we expected. Nothing special but we didn't come for anything other than an what I guess you would call and American Breakfast. Eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes and hash browns. Small drink cups which is fine if the server is on top of it. We liked it

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Gq5TWEqfh0FuKSVwv0cT3A.text: All good. Seated right away, ordered right away, food came out in a timely manner. Manager came up to table to greet us.

_8NqQ1AbKfEv_UAOFQzH5Q.text: The menu is too overwhelming and the food isn't all that great. Comparable to a Denny's or IHOP.

CsNtgh_i-ZJley3GsLOdEA.text: This location needs to take a lesson from the I-17 and bell location.   We frequently eat at US egg so when work brought us to this side of town we decided to eat here.   The menu and the decor are the same but that is where the similarity ends.   The pancakes were tiny and my omelette was much smaller which seems impossible since it's a three egg omelette.  I get the same thing every time I go so was surprised the bill was higher; apparently at this location i get charged extra for my egg whites.  The english muffin was burnt and my avacado was bad (see picture).  Sadly a bad experience at a chain that is usually amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burnt muffin and bad avacado

eB0H9pDrF55YOC2DaV1aEg.text: The food and staff are great! We went to three different places (on a Sunday after 11) looking for good breakfast before heading to the airport. All three had wait time around an hour. I guess it was fate because we came here and only had to wait about 15 minutes. We were seated outside where we were told it was heated to about 78 but if we weren't pleased to ask for another table. Oh, I forgot to mention the average temperature here is usually in the high 60s low 70s but it's about 59 today. Of course the wind was whipping pretty hard. So, we got another table inside very quickly. The waitress didn't take anytime to come over and took our order. They were very accommodating and allowed for substitutions (with minimal cost). The portion sizes are huge! I ate EVERY bite and shouldn't need anything else to eat for the day. The protein pancakes were as promised, something to come back for. If I ever come back to the area, I will definitely come here. Besides, there are so many other things on the menu that I'd like to try.

ybLG4PqcBCgRWTRasWLZsw.text: We eat here at least once every time we visit Scottsdale. It's always great! The breakfast selections and quality are top notch, and the service is extremely friendly and accommodating and quick. We love this place.

7luoBVbS2JCUdjPVH33Ybg.text: This place never disappoints me and my family. Always good food, good service and fast service. I tell my friends all the time why waste your time with all the expensive trendy places in o town were you get a hung over party girl as your server! The absolute best! Oh and very clean too!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QlVHcQViL5fE9uY5Pw9aZg.text: Came here at 8:00 this morning with my son looking for a good hot breakfast experience. The restaurant was 1/3 full.  I ordered the chicken mushroom omelet with mushroom cream sauce, hash browns and an English Muffin. It arrived barely warm and upon complaining was brought a side of sauce.  I will not return...my omelet obviously.was either not fresh made or sat in the kitchen too long. Even the muffin had need pre toasted and served as if an afterthought. Hash browns were blah. Mashed inferior...barely crisped at all. My son had eggs over easy with a tiny grilled chicken breast and a side of spinach. Couldn't eat the unseasoned, lukewarm spinach, but his eggs and grill marked chicken were adequately hot. He commented that we might have faired better at Dennys...though we both avoid that alternative. If your looking for a good traditional breakfast, I'd recommend you avoid US Egg. I paid $27. 99 minus tip...water to drink which would be ok if food was hot and better prepared...it was not! Right now turned off of getting a breakfast experience for a while!  Wait staff barely made it to our table to leave bill...let alone ask how the food was.

HgBWKMhu0UHDq-CkiJQnZQ.text: Favorite local Breakfast spot, Been coming here a few times when I can but I'm a sucker for the French toast and at this place it surely does the trick everything is good here, and if you are an egg person this is the spot, I love it and would recommend it to anybody, I been to the one in Phoenix on Greenway and i feel this one in Scottsdale is the better one because of its location with the other breakfast spots are nearby in the old town area and the fact you don't see the older people (grandma/grandpa) and kids at this location because I guess families tend to stay away from this side of town that's cater to the single life. But overall I love this spot, ill choose this over Dennys and IHOP anyday!!

q7NdY0HTZEUfhjcquMc-1w.text: Went their for a team-building breakfast the other day. It's been a little while since I set foot in here.   As far as a breakfast/brunchery place, it'll probably hit the spot for most people. They have decent portions, decent prices and a vast selection of menu items.   There is just a few things I would like to see homemade. Their corn beef hash is straight out of a can, their country gravy is straight out of a bag. If I remember correctly it's mixed with 3 qts. cold water, then added to 1 qt boiling water, and SHAZAAM! you have instant country gravy (I'd like to thank my first cooking job at Flying J for leaving that bit of knowledge in my head. )  Any way, the service is pretty good. We were there on a weekday, so business wasn't that bad. But I remember coming here on a Saturday years ago and the poor staff just got pummeled.   So I give this place an average rating with food that will please most. They seem to be in business for quantity over quality.

VkeEH9ZBWJsGAMn9jLEc8A.text: This place is sorta pricey but the food, oh man, the food is soooo freakin' good. Especially if you love eggs and pancakes!

TnKYF7ve0DPvGU2Xq-uVhw.text: Received really great, friendly and quick service.  My server, Amber I think was her name, was on top of everything.

VZBeEKB2-jLeGjATT2UyfA.text: I heart the 'Protein Pancake!'   Typical breakfast goodness. Big plus-- being a soda connoisseur, their unending flow of diet coke is worthy of cracking any one's hangover!

UXk66r-oeMHeM8oZg2bvsA.text: US Egg is a great breakfast place.  The Half and half is the best of both worlds.  You get to try their signature protein pancakes and your choice of half a skillet.

Ugke-FWed7wme7YvX8uoOw.text: Cute place. Full menu. Food was a little cold. Coffee was good :)

8ZTuN8Od92edgzKAoc41Yg.text: Solid 4 stars every time!   The Protein pancakes are a favorite for a good reason.   They're great and filling with the right kind of ingredients.   I recommend the 1/2 and 1/2 which is two good sized protein pancakes with 1/2 a skillet variety and one egg.  Their iced tea is decent and we've always had service that was at least better than average.   Easy to find and reasonable prices.   Winner!  (Now why they are listed under 'Burgers' instead of breakfast, well who knows.)

5Rua9226KpWJf3zZ6CdXOg.text: It wasn't until my second visit here that I realized this place is not The Good Egg, hahahaaa  Ok...so I may have called in sick one day from work because I needed a "me" day and started it off with U.S. Egg.  What a brilliant idea suggested by my gentleman caller.    I ordered the Horn of Plenty Omelet and yes it was!  I just can't seem to order anything but omelets.  I love all the diced veggies, cheese and yummy egg.  I sampled some of his blueberry pancakes and washed it down with coffee and OJ.  It just doesn't get any better than that!    The service was great and the wait was short (but it was a work day).    *I did go back on a weekend and the wait was not bad.  Side note:  I still have not tried the Good Egg but it's on the list.

6iFS1vtQ6WWgpHxTZc9K_g.text: I found this online while in town for work. This restaurant looks nice, has great staff, has excellent food cooked to your liking, and very fair prices. I will put this on my list for next trip into town. Best service I've experienced in a long time, too.

4f6YFqfF5eqLsJKiVJsjSg.text: I've been over 10 times and every time it is great. Half and Half (protein pancakes and skillet) is amazing.

SGZYIMM5-5FQiWATMqaRrw.text: I once had a guy take me on a date here because he loved the food so much.  I had never been, and though the relationship with that guy didn't work out, I don't think my love for U.S. Egg's Protein Pancakes will ever fizzle.   The atmosphere is nothing to write home about, but the staff is always extremely friendly and service is pretty timely.  Portions are quite large, but the menu is a tad on the expensive side for a breakfast place.  If you're going for anything other than pancakes or waffles, especially egg dishes, it can be a game of roulette with the quality, but I've never been disappointed.

4g4QpDNyQwrDecekg_2BUg.text: After having breakfast here for the third time, must say I wasn't quite as pleased. Although the service was great, along with atmosphere, my breakfast wasn't as I was acustomed to, so I felt the need to express this. However, I will try once again, and will post corresponding changes here as well.

sAow9VFKeuqR99rj5G3rCA.text: This place is delicious.  Five of us went for breakfast after running the AZ Urban Race and it was exactly what we needed.  Huge menu and the food was great.  I heart breakfast food!  The prices are slightly pricey for a breakfast menu but nothing unreasonable.  Plus - you get a LOT of food.

w-EcBMcDL0aWapEu6iP9uQ.text: I have ate here many times, and had the chance to eat here again this past February. I went with the protein pancakes again. Still as good as I remember. The place wasn't as busy as I remember it was and they really need to do something about the fruit fly's, they were annoying. All in all, good food.

LrmMsFq46qFUlN_rlQ7ltw.text: Really good omelet. Very large portions and a great wait staff. The prices are good for as much food that you get. They also lease a pitcher of water or coffee so you can refill your own drinks. I think this is a nice touch. Location is really easy to get to.

Lf4WWuuRSGjhOHFKJv-wmQ.text: Boom Susan!!! This place is solid. Ordered up 2 poached eggs extra crispy bacon, hash browns and toast. Everything was cooked perfect and the service was on point. Only complaint is that it's a little pricey but then again you get what you pay for.

CdBb9ILzg9t5sTcgg4EamQ.text: This was our first visit to US Egg and we were told that it is busy but worth the wait.  Well it was True...we waited about 25 minutes for our table (not bad for a Sunday morning).  The food was worth the wait....very fresh and hot.  A couple of mix ups on the order but they were corrected very quickly and did not interfere with anyone have to watch while the rest of eat.  Would definitely recommend for anyone looking to have a good breakfast or lunch.  Only negative is that it is a little noisy if you are trying to carry on a conversation with someone several seats away.

8_msTbWHiOQdUl9xvPADGg.text: We had a solid experience here with both the food and service.  Had the Santa Fe skillet and I *almost* wanted to ask them for some hollandaise sauce to pour on top, but my heart was telling me "DEAR GOD NOOOO."  The Lady had the spinach omelette, which was also very tasty.  What I probably liked the most about the place was that they provided a pitcher of Arnold Palmer at the table so that I could drink to my heart's content.  Even at the end of the meal, I was offered a to-go cup for the remaining drink.  That was awesome.  Is there any place around here that has a BLT with avocado and some green pepper sauce?  I guess taht'd make it a "BLAT" or something.... either way I wanna try one.

2OrOAcih4X43tmATNrI_Gg.text: US Egg is a good, no wait breakfast joint that I frequent quite often. I've only ever been here on a Saturday or Sunday, after a long night of drinking, but the food is always delicious, servers are friendly, and they give you huge portions. The protein pancakes are one of my favorite things to eat, as well as the Sonoran Burrito. I always leave this place really full with some good left overs.

1O2eEsoRVybG7EG7yRaSOQ.text: 1. coffee warm, not hot. 2. Both of us ordered potatoes crispy; one came regular and one well done - had to send back. 3. GLASS IN WAFFLE when i bit into it!!!!!! Credited this breakfast, not the coffee, ruined our breakfast, should have credited the $18.00.  Glass in the waffle!  At least they acknowledged that something broke in the kitchen.

FN8Qs3xjE9KhaUl7f4338w.text: Aaaaand, for review #400...a five star kicker for this great scrambler of all that is egg based!  My dad and I are staying across the street at the Marriott Courtyard, and decided to give US Egg a try!  So glad we did, as the food, service, and decor were a hit.  The American flag decor was especially appreciated by my dad, who is a veteran.  Our server Monica was fast on the delivery of a freshly brewed decanter of coffee.  We perused the massive menu, and selected two egg based choices.  Dad went with the traditional two egg breakfast, served with bacon, hash browns, and an English muffin.  I ordered the California Eggs Benedict.  No sooner had we sipped our coffee's first slurp...and breakfast was served!  So fast!  Our meals came out in no less than 5 minutes!  Fresh, hot, and nicely prepared.  My dad was very happy with his over easy eggs, yolks soft and runny as he likes, with crisp and large swaths of bacon on the side.  My benedict eggs were fantastic, with large wedges of avocado and thick slices of fresh tomatoes.  Delicious and all bathed in a tangy hollandaise sauce...soooo good!  Also very nice, our served brought us a nice large pitcher of ice water.  So great to re-hydrate here in the desert!  We had a great breakfast here, and I would highly recommend coming here for quick, fresh, and delicious food and service.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

-myIIZBOGJBGCoMyPLFziA.text: The service is quick and friendly, exactly what you'd expect from a no-frills breakfast place. Funny thing about US Egg is I'm definitely a fan although I absolutely hate eggs.  During my last visit I was served by Erica, she was friendly and pleasant. My meal came out cooked perfectly and it was really good. I had corned beef and hash, with hash browns, bacon and sourdough toast. I rarely finish a big breakfast but I ate every bit of this. You really can't beat a classic restaurant place. No major complaints about this location, it's very lively and clean.   One thing I will say is a bummer is not being able to substitute for the eggs on the corned beef and hash meal, it increased my ticket $5 not being able to do that. Other than that it's good.

SS8_19IE3hLAkSszck3J1g.text: US Egg is our go-to place for breakfast.  They are so good at customizing your order, and ensuring you get what you want.  My favorite is their Florentine special - yummy spinach, mushrooms with eggs and hollandaise.  How can you go wrong?  I love their grits, and they serve a big bowl with lots of butter.  I know - it's so bad/good, but I only get them once in a while. Guilty pleasure.   My husband loves their protein pancakes - they are really flavorful.  He also loves the chorizo and the way they will deep fry the hash browns for you.  And now they have mimosas and bloody Mary's available.  Heaven.

go7jT9UY8decTF1uVXVjIQ.text: Food:        3/5 Service:   4/5 Decor:      3/5  Not the worst place I've ever had. Clearly they're doing something right with the amount of good reviews here.  Construction in the parking area but not the biggest deal.  Weird odor outside. Something leaked into the parking spots and smells like rotten milk.  The interior seems a bit outdated. The staff is nice. The food is very.... mediocre. Kinda plain and dry. Veggie Benedict was.... ok.  Fresh squeezed OJ was good.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WHyBx45hW3PJ4HstvscI_A.text: We ate here twice during our stay across the street. We first had breakfast, chicken and waffles and chicken fried steak. We were seated quickly and Laura was very attentive. The food came out quickly and got and were generous portions. The flavor was good, gravy was yummy! Lunch we had the Scottsdale Salad and Turkey Melt and were equally happy with the service and the taste of the food. Highly recommend!

zklt32E4cG5lz3n0I3Rcig.text: When I'm in Scottsdale in the mornings this is my favorite place to grab a great breakfast. They serve breakfast and lunch until 2:30PM daily, I love breakfast so I haven't ventured over to the lunch menu yet.   They have everything you would expect for breakfast or lunch. Service is great and food comes out fast.   My favorite thing is the Hawkeye omelette. Chicken, bacon, avocado, tomatoes and jack cheese. Amazing!  The omelettes are huge so be hungry!   Weekdays you can usually get seated right away at any hour. Weekends are packed though so expect a wait.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hawkeye omelette served with hash browns and english muffin.

wuUvqcnBBCSgsarqKA4r2g.text: A solid option for a delicious breakfast in Scottsdale. A popular spot, but we were able to get a table immediately early on a Saturday morning.   The menu has so many great options. The hard part was narrowing to just one breakfast item per person. There are about a dozen options each for omelets, specialties, and pancakes/waffles. Benedicts and traditional breakfast options are also available. U.S. Egg is also a lunch spot.   I had the Going South Omelet which had chorizo, green chiles, and cheese inside. It was served with a side of hash browns. It was a really large and had plenty of filling, especially the chorizo. This is the kind of breakfast that allows you to completely bypass lunch. My husband had the Sonora breakfast burrito. The Sonora has the same filling ingredients as the Going South Omelet, but is all stuffed into a giant burrito. The Sonora also comes with a side of hash browns. Other sides can be substituted at an additional charge. My husband enjoyed his burrito, but the outside is a little on the dry side. It comes with salsa, but it would probably be better smothered Christmas style. Overall, both dishes were satisfying though.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sonora Burrito
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Going South Omelet

SNjTPTR7EO-Du7LNrLrqFg.text: Just finished breakfast at this great joint near Old Town.  I ordered the classic eggs benedict and a fruit plate. My server was Kim and she was friendly and prompt. I received my food within 20 minutes of sitting down.   Both plates were good. I was surprised to see the quantity of fruit on the fruit plate. Most restaurants cheap out with their fruit plates, but not here.   My only request is that they add more benedict plates to their menu. It would be nice to have more options.   Regardless, I had a good, easy, and quick experience here. Thanks guys!

KPWvrqcQaDZVQH7-0IMoJw.text: In my one visit here, I wasn't too impressed. My 'omelette' was really a large folded egg batter with the ingredients placed between the fold, rather than mixed-in to the batter. This made it hard to eat, especially since the egg was dry. The steamed spinach on the side was good, until it got cold and soggy. The waitresses were very helpful and attentive  The price was too high, I can go to a better restaurant up Scottsdale road for a better meal at a cheaper price

Zf7q7tfe5KtVFyyCLABBSw.text: Good food, good service in a nice location. Iv'e eaten breakfast here several times and at their other locations.  Always seated quickly, menu has good selections and food is prepared well and served by friendly hosts.

3BEv0R9gVsvogYto2zOcyA.text: Absolutely fantastic food and service, I wish I could remember the sweetheart who served us, I think it was McCall or something unique of that sort? She deserves a raise !!! I got the meat lovers skillet, with the suggestion of our server, and I just about cried with satisfaction, I truly wish I were exaggerating. Very cute, classic-American, atmosphere and I will absolutely be back for that dang skillet, it's huge and able to be saved for later. Thanks to you, my morning was one of the best yet!

A-dRqx5dO-_P6fVnhPs4XQ.text: I was after some mimosas for breakfast and ended up with some eggs benny too!

CxHbhytdMs4dADmT9LUCTQ.text: Sits right across the street from Dennys but it usually is busy especially on Sundays,the place is decidedly a cut above Dennys for it has more panache.Food and service are generally good all though my mother and I did have one lifeless meal .I would rate it a 3.5,it has gotten better from when they first opened up,Interesting menu items so it is worth a visit.It is a local chain.That have additional enclosed parking in back.I definitely plan on returning.

kRStYiM7fWMw717P5CZBjA.text: I want in on owning this US Egg in Scottsdale.  The volume they crank out is incredible.  We had a short wait then into the packed rest. and off to the races.  Nice that they give you a pot of coffee at the table so you can pour away.  I had the huevos rancheros-quite good- and my friends had a split meal with a small skillet and two pancakes.  We had just summitted Camelback Mountain so the food hit the spot.   The kitchen fired up the food quickly and service was quick as we needed to get going to a spring training game it all was perfecto!  Yes-how do I get a piece of the action?

vp6ib0lzvJoPSArIeqOG1Q.text: Not very good food. Service is pretty bad too. Only positive is that it isnt a long wait during normal brunch hours, likely because it's nowhere near as good as any other brunch restaurant in the area.

-X-h_DOb4YzccVY3Cec-Rg.text: Clean and very friendly staff, the menu had great options. I ordered the eggs, with shaved turkey and fruit. Healthy portions and very fresh and tasty. Noise was at decent level where you can still hold a conversation. Great place! PS the coffee was also good

43Yb8fVS7RyFuM6XEp5v4g.text: The Eggs Benedict here really impressed me - and trust me, I'm a tough audience when it comes to the way I like Eggs Benedict.  I guess you could call me an egg snob?  Eat here if you enjoy a good brunch!

yf0wxg561npaQ-tZzz6FZA.text: Poor presentation. Barely any salsa over the top of it. I have come to the us egg a few times and have never been overly impressed, but this is embarrassing. Don't order takeout.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ordered the Sonora Burrito from US Egg for takeout. Picture speaks for itself... Not Impressed at all.

Zn2lYyIyIcp2--B8MSetbA.text: This place was terrible. The wait was twice as long as we were told. The food was mediocre at best. The beef was dry in the cheese steak. We asked for over medium eggs and got runny snot. We sent it back by the time they returned everyone else had finished and the eggs were still unacceptable. Asked for a manager who was Falsely apologetic amd did not take it off the bill, and literally said "poached eggs are hard to make" as well as "the chef said if he cooked them longer they would be hard" aka saying they didnt agree with our order. Very bad experience period.

kXhEIFdenpKGGxdij896gg.text: We wanted brunch on our last day in Scottsdale and we read the reviews which were excellent. Very kids friendly and health conscious as well.  Everything lived up to the reviews and the menu was full of yummy breakfast and lunch items. I loved the protein pancakes with the oats and the kids got the chocolate chip pancakes and ate them all and even shared another order of them lol. Friendly staff and manager/owner.

9noovHAsMKcQ0f3WLDkGWg.text: The food was excellent had the mushroom omelette & the amazing protein pancake..I was stuffed.. Good service family friendly

6MaNlz2AHjF9r3uJ80_gtQ.text: Holy Pancakes!!! What a meal we had. We were in the area and decided we needed a BIG breakfast. I looked through the pictures on YELP and couldn't decide what looked more satisfying. We get there around 1130, NO WAIT at all. Perfect for me because I was getting pretty "Hangry". Looking through this delicious menu I wanted everything, but this waitress wasn't going to wait forever, as patient as she was. I'm down to try new things but I know what I like and the ITALY OMELETTE was calling my name. Mushrooms, sausage, mozzarella cheese, marinara and pepperoni on top. What omelette can beat that? Yeah I couldn't think of one either haha. But why stop there? I'm a girl with a sweet tooth so I ordered powered sugar french toast off of the kids menu (pretty filling) and added bananas on top. A little extra charge but who cares when you're hungry right? Just go bananas you'll thank yourself later!!! I also had the pleasure of eating off of my boyfriends plate. He kept it simple & light and ordered a sirloin steak with broccoli. I rather indulge in the good, "yet not so good for you" food, but then again that's just me! He splurged a little and got their famous protein pancake. Good for you carb and calorie counters. It was massive, filled with blueberries, granola, cinnamon and almonds. Simply delicious. Now that I have your mouth watering I think it's time you come in and taste for yourself. Remember: Go Bananas!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Italy Omelette. Sausage, mushrooms, mozzarella cheese and pepperoni
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kids Menu French Toast
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Massive protein pancake.

lYjfCOMC12jaNYq6C3GGdg.text: My favorite breakfast place when I come to Az.  Their omelets are amazing and yesterday I had their protein blueberry  pancakes so very  yummy.   My better half had the chicken fried steak he lived it. Also the bloody marys are bomb they have bacon and pickles.  Service is 5 star! Best breakfast place around

lvFR0APdyqp8SqY_Q7gqnA.text: Met up with a friend here after a night at the casino. Really happy with the food, got the blueberry oatmeal pancakes and they were delicious. Husband got the skillet and it was just as good. Kind of pricey for breakfast but excellent food and service. Will return back to this place.

wfoe0qQcjc6fMZMYNmBPdw.text: Excellent - food and service! Tried this restaurant for brunch as was meeting out-of-town friend and the reviews were super, and as it turned out, accurate! Several familiar brunch items and then another dimension of "don't miss" specialties. I had the half and half with the US Egg Protein Pancakes and it was delicious! This is The Place to go for a treat for family, friends, guests and best of all you owe it to yourself!

Fxl7f3CU3B9RZVxwPoY8lw.text: Breakfast...  a leisurely one is a great way to start a weekend.  On a recent Saturday morning, my friend and I stopped by U.S. Egg in search of a favorite breakfast indulgence - Eggs Benedict.   We were seated promptly, and our friendly waitress highly recommended both the Eggs Benedict (for me) and a slight variation, the California Benedict (including bacon and avocado), for her.    Both dishes looked great when they arrived, and even included a nice side of hash browns.  However, the letdown was immediate when I cut in to my first egg.  The yolk was... solid!  No delightfully runny goodness to mix with the hollandaise.  My friend's eggs were overdone as well.  What happened?  My guess is the dishes sat a bit too long under a heat lamp after being plated.  So disappointing.  :(  I may give U.S. Egg another try, as a number of other menu items looked tempting.  The restaurant was bright and inviting, and the service was quick and friendly.  Still, how can you serve Eggs Benedict with overcooked yolks!?

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Eggs Benedict - pretty, but the yolks were HARD!  :(
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

nR_Ksc0Cs1DkJKDz126_RQ.text: Service was fast and friendly, food was good, not great.  I ordered the california benedict and the hollandaise sauce was a bit too thin for my liking.  All and all i did like the vibe of the place, but the food was just above average.

q5okMqxPzfb8_7ANvuywMw.text: Went to the one in old town for breakfast. My first time and it was delicious! The food was great, service fantastic! I will be back for sure!

RaKVqnV2gKL65SeRW8lruw.text: US egg is cute, it reminds me of the smaller breakfast diners but it's so big Today, Sunday, it is very busy but there was a 10 min wait... Not long... They put complimentary coffee outside as well as water Inside is very huge and open so it's a little loud but I enjoy it...  Makes it feel more like breakfast  Our server, Whitney, is super nice and knowledgable of the menu I wasn't quite sure of what to get as they have a big menu as well Big place-Big menu, go figure ;) I asked for her recommendations and she was very helpful I ended up getting the decaf coffee  And The chicken fried steak with eggs  Very good portion  The eggs are good, over easy The hash browns are a little dry and plain so I added pepper and ketchup The chicken fried steak has good flavor and the gravy does too  Good first experience

wx5M_O8S61b_zH2iyPQVUg.text: I have been coming here for years and will continue to do so. It first started with their famous protein pancakes! It's a great location, always get seated quickly even on busy weekends.  The best part about US EGG is the very polite staff. I can't recommend this place enough.

sRDGMIKOu1f8ynI4wuOgjQ.text: Wow!! Absolutely stellar food and service. It was my first time trying this place out, ordered the steak and eggs, and was frankly blown away because I wasn't expecting such high quality steak from a breakfast place. Every bite was savory and spectacular. Eggs were cooked to perfection as were the hash browns. Ask for Brittani; she was great!

iEhEnwpkuSUDtE7ScjqcVg.text: Service is fast and actually pretty good. Restaurant is large so you're seated pretty quickly. The food is pretty average. The eggs are fine; hashbrowns are very boring and dry. The bacon is pretty good, but not crispy. Whole wheat pancakes are pretty good, too. Honestly, the food is reminiscent of IHOP, but less greasy/a little better quality.  I don't know if I'd come back, but I wouldn't necessarily shy away either. Overall, 3 stars/A-OK is very accurate.

tEgg2quV4Vmhnr58Kgl5XQ.text: Ate here twice on a trip to Scottsdale.  For me to eat more than once at a place while visiting is unusual and indicates a "must-go" restaurant.  Everything we ordered was perfectly cooked and very tasty.  I especially liked that the breakfast burrito actually had some heat to it.

HPz2TXemt3k9ebf5VKhVow.text: I have driven by US Eggs several times on my way in or out of Old Town Scottsdale.  US Eggs has to have one of the tallest buildings I have ever seen for a restaurant.  One morning, I decided to give it a shot.  I did a little research on Yelp, and I saw that people enjoyed the protein pancakes.  I eat quite a bit of protein supplements, so I was wondering if they somehow infused whey protein powder into the pancake batter.  It actually has fresh blueberries, cinnamon, and almonds.  I think the batter had whole grain wheat.  I decided to go with the half and half, which gave me 2 mini protein pancakes (humongous) and an Idaho Skillet that came with potatoes, your choice of 1 egg, and a type of sauce such as Cajun spices, Santa Fe, or various other assortments.  Each of my friends got the same dish, but with different skillet sauces.  We enjoyed the Cajun, Santa Fe, and chicken avocado.  The best part of the experience is that you definitely get your money's worth.  If you ever have a hard workout or are extremely hungry, come to US Eggs for a power-packed breakfast.

b4X8pjRzhJfBVOU-qhoiDQ.text: I like the variety of breakfast items. It's easy to give every one a choice of items and sizes of breakfast. I do like the protein pancakes. They're a whole grain pancake, with nuts, a little coconut?, blueberries, etc. I make them unhealthy with all the butter. They don't really need the syrup. Service is always pleasant and fast. They leave you with a carafe of coffee and a pitcher of water.

VhrUwBl7mwL9jGejUT0XuQ.text: Very disappointed with brunch here. I ordered the Eggs Benedict.  The eggs were overcooked (cooked all the way through, no running yolk), and they used very little hollandaise sauce. If a restaurant with the word "egg" in its name cannot make a decent Eggs Benedict, you know it's a bad restaurant.    If the yolk doesn't run, I run.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Terrible eggs Benedict. Overcooked egg!

0dWgThuU3AD0AMxbYC0gmg.text: I enjoy the California Benedict.  The service is always friendly and the food comes out fairly quickly.    The coffee is standard restaurant quality, but more expensive than starbucks or coffee bean!

bhHRMNFFFKP2ilJCI-S_0w.text: What a rip off. If I had seen the Einstein's on the opposite corner before placing my to go order over the phone, I would have gone there. But being from out of town, I was at their mercy. I ordered a bacon egg and cheese bagel. It was for my son. He said it tasted like ass. To add insult to injury, it cost $10.50. I could've gotten the same at Einstein's for four dollars

4MR3ar_2shCFjwihZkQAtg.text: Meh. I've experienced better.  Seating was fast. Server was great. They had coffee set out while we waited for our table, but the coffee station was messy and coffee was empty. Boo!   At breakfast, half of my breakfast came to the table cold. My eggs were warm, but my hash browns, bacon and belgian waffle were cold. I can deal with cold bacon, but as I tried to spread the butter across my "fresh" waffle, it just "sat" on top. Ewww.   Our server was awesome. I was able to let her know right away that although I was ok with keeping the bacon and eggs, I really wanted a hot belgian waffle. She apologized and took it back to the kitchen, where the kitchen committed a cardinal sin... they took the same waffle I just sent back and put it in the microwave.   I suspected it was the same waffle when I saw the caramel-colored brown spots on top where I tried to spread the butter previously, but just to be sure I checked the bottom. Yep; soggy from the microwave.  Ewww.  I was no longer in the mood for a belgian waffle.   I would give it one star, but I appreciated my server, and I actually really like the casual decor, the patio and the restrooms.

9rOdBbW7mDR1Bxs3G_Dk4A.text: My co-workers always talk about this place so I figured to give it a try with a group of friends. I ordered the 1/2 meat lovers skillet with blueberry protein pancakes....it was BOMB! The sweetness of cinnamon and blueberries just went so together with the syrup. The skillet itself was phenomenal. My girlfriend loved her eggs Benedict. I think I just found my Sunday breakfast joint!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7pBcZ2hy95CVsCmb_7s8yQ.text: I love this place. Both Tempe & Scottsdale locations. We are always greeted warmly, seated promptly, and the wait staff is perfect. I love that they leave a pitcher of water and a carafe of coffee. I also love that they dont freak out when I want two bacon strips & two sausage links.

TtwCPAbJF3y8nPDZivbChg.text: I had the half and half so I can get the famous protein pancakes. My girlfriend had the Turkey sausage with scramble eggs and English muffin.  the protein pancakes were delcious. The service was fast, I must say they do very well with handling crowd getting people seated.

wwkMbERRelB6MRrFsWWAhA.text: Protein pancakes....get half order...special protein waffle...both really good.  I thought service was fine for a breakfast joint. I would encourage one of the owners who seated us to smile once in a while because he looked mean and or pissed off.  On the other hand, they were getting rid of their silk plants (which I hate in any restaurant) for some other decor...good on ya.  I will return for the pancakes.

nlDfJrDiYy6-L3jNj66irw.text: The food and service were outstanding. The omelettes and skillet dishes were the best that we ever experienced. The pricing is good. There were lots of people. There was a 20 minute wait in a breakfast line. Obviously, other people have the same opinion about U.S. Egg, otherwise why would so many people wait in a breakfast line. We will gladly wait in that line again to repeat our good experience with that restaurant.

yg6xKJqmRcfUGTxamA0Wig.text: U.S. Egg has been a family favorite for years (Tempe location).  It isn't somewhere to go for a gourmet meal, but for high quality American breakfast food, it's a winner.  The wait staff is always great about substitutions, the guys (owners) at the front are charming and the food comes out quickly.  I am an egg white omelet girl, but my parents love the protein pancakes that are full of granola and blueberries.

iWlgNXU-fzhurcQlcmxD_A.text: Stopped by here with my girlfriend before driving out to LA. The protein pancakes were delicious, and the eatery had a nice homely vibe to it. However, the huge depiction of the United States on one of their walls is a cheap simplification at best..

al8vyagaquGHIohGncnKjg.text: I tried US Egg for the first time last month and have been back several times. The menu is a mix bag with some really good items (like the Protein Pancakes, Biscuits and Gravy and BLT Sandwich) and some not so good items, like any omelet covered in one of US Egg's horrible sauces.  AVOID the "sauces"at  ALL COSTS!   Generally, I order extra sauce, but the Hollandaise, Cajun, and "Gentleman Jim's" sauces are pretty gross.  The "Cajun" sauce is the worst.  A weirdly flavored, brown-tan mess, with bits of gum-chewy mushrooms.  Yuck.      The hosts and wait staff go out of their way to be friendly.  The bright, airy dinning room is nice, and relaxing. Order coffee or tea and get a whole pot.  I appreciate the quick service and consistency (even the sauce is consistently bad!) and they never glass (or mug) run dry, without refilling whatever you are drinking.  Prices are reasonable.

7yFCyhPdyL3BKQ7tcZmicg.text: Had a great brunch type meal to start my day and recommend getting the half & half.  You can't go wrong.  Sizeable portions.  On weekends, it gets super busy so I go during the week.  Also ordered take-out and was finished on time.

d3K5Aq4RRAo-L5BdlDgK5A.text: I'm not typically a breakfast kind of guy, but occasionally I get a craving for breakfast foods. Whenever I get this craving, U.S. Egg is my go-to place. The half-and-half breakfast is the best of both worlds, you get a great egg and potato skillet plus their awesome protein pancakes.

JhSLyT3MvUtecnd02VR_Iw.text: this was our first breakfast hit-up since we moved back, and gotta say it again....the protein pancakes are still da bomb. so lucious, cruchy yet soft, sweet yet salty, healthy but so much syrup...mmmm! go at an off time or you'll be knocking elbows with the elderly.

i1OI9IlXeYDt_XrnvO5Vkw.text: The hash browns were like cubed french fries. I liked them. The food was good. There was a slice of an orange on my plate. I thought it was a garnish of some sort or was to be used to squirt the juice on the food but she told me to eat it. I thought it was weird to have just one slice of orange and grapefruit on a plate. They give patrons a pitcher of coffee to drink even if you order only one cup. I gave myself 3 refills. There was a little tray of cream to get the coffee on track. The breakfast sandwich was about the same as it would anywhere else. Breakfast food is hard to mess up. The waitress was solid and I thought this place was pretty cool.

HblHrAwEqPmBWdLlZJMUfg.text: Wow. This is the best breakfast pre-race, post-race and remembering I used to race place! We were in town for that Ironman and ate here no less than 3 times in about 5 days. Delicious and hearty breakfasts. The servers were all really fast and friendly and i even saw one of them volunteering on race day! I think my husband would consider this the best pancake he's put in his mouth. I think they were called Power Pancakes or something.  The eggs/omelets are also very tasty. The only downfall I see is that we don't have this place at home.

XDgNm0FPZD8BGZuaWf55TA.text: Great place for breakfast or lunch. I really like the low carb menu. Friendly staff. Get there early as there can usually be a long line because of the great food.

NbnoQcuk8nh821rDAk4J1Q.text: Just like Denny's and ihope. Breakfast fast-food

ZFJnvXNd3X3NJad4t0eaKg.text: A great place. The service was excellent even with a large table. Protein pancakes are amazing.

DLajrAiSWPD6guA5kmSKcA.text: Food is good, not great, prices reasonable.  Service on the other hand is horrible.  Last time I ate there, the food came out cold and when brought to the attention of the waitperson, who by the way couln't be found for 15 minutes, she gave us the dear in headlights look and said "sorry".  That was it.  Highly suggest this restaurant get back to basics, because it seems to start at the hop.  The manager is just as bad.

nFe9oLujqOM569BNRt-VnQ.text: Really enjoyed this breakfast joint. It reminded me alot of the good egg. The prices were reasonable, the portions were huge, and the quality was very good. The power pancakes were excellent, and quite different from any other pancake that I've had. The server was very courteous as well. Definitely a repeater.

6Jwj4l1vp3ve63JTfbiFxg.text: I wanted something light when I went here with friends recently so I ordered the fruit plate. This fruit plate was GINORMOUS -- nice!  It seriously lasted me for a few days. Besides giving a thumbs up on the portions of my meal, our server was really friendly. Next time I go I'm definitely gonna go for protein pancakes.

YQKTP-kPm-smm3IZucpYeQ.text: I was looking for a good idea for breakfast in my South Scottsdale neighborhood, and just could not pass by the 27 good reviews of US Egg in good conscience without relaying my very different experience - one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had.  I usually like US Egg but had never been to this location until about 6-8 weeks ago. A friend and I were running around doing errands and decided to stop for a quick bite what turned out to be about 13 minutes before closing. We asked if they were still serving, the answer from the host was yes, of course and were shown to our table. I made a quick run to the ladies' room while my friend ordered coffee and got menus. And it was when I returned to the table that things began their nose-dive.    Evidently our waitress had dropped off the menus and told my friend that we needed to hurry and order, and actually expressed annoyance that I was in the ladies room. Hmm. At this point I gave US Egg the benefit of the doubt. People don't actually say things like that! But when the waitress came to take our order, she was clearly annoyed. So much so, I asked if it was too late to get a meal, told her we'd asked at the door when we arrived. She said we'd have to hurry but they were still open. I chalked it up to her being tired at the end of her work day. We ordered immediately, and breakfast arrived quickly.   The food was a disaster: coffee was cold, the eggs were not cooked, the veggies were not edible, the hollandaise was out of a can or other container and had been microwaved or something, still retaining the shape of the container (read not warmed enough). Just thinking about it now, makes me shudder. Honestly, I could not eat it. I tried. We were hungry. While we "ate" someone came over to our area and mopped the floor with some very strong smelling cleaning solution. OMG. There was no one else sitting around us. We did not get coffee refills. The waitress left the building. And we had to flag someone else down who was clearly annoyed to have to bring coffee and the bill. She saw that we had not eaten and offered a container, but we declined. A good opportunity to point out the raw broccoli and jellied hollandaise and said we did not want to take it with us, it was not a good meal at all, and we'd wished that they had simply told us no, they could not serve us at the door. She shrugged.    The host/manager sat at a table near the door reading one of the free newspapers from the rack near the door, appearing to be killing time, waiting to close, unaware of what was happening. We did not complain. The problem was with multiple personnel, including him. No one - host, two waitresses, cook(s) and floor clean-up guy took any pride in their work or showed any sign of "welcoming" us into their establishment. Instead of being so rude and wasting our time and thiers, they should have politely asked us to come back another time when we came in the door. That would have been fine.    We could not wait to get out of there. I left a minimal tip (I was not going to let them decide my response to their bad behavior). I paused at the door looking back at our table. I was amazed to see that there were at least 3 other tables of people eating, so we were certainly not the last lingering guests. The manager never even looked up from his reading and we walked right by him. On the way to the car I swore to myself that I'd find and write a letter to the *owner* but never did. More wasted time. We were just never going back. Ugh. This was one of the most "inhospitable" hospitality experiences I've ever had. I fully expected the restaurant to be closed by now. And instead, I see positive reviews? Bewildering.

31MT5C7a-STUFwL6KyNcpA.text: it is True that the protein pancakes here are good, but overall this is just an average, "big box" place for brunch.  nothing bad, just nothing especially good about it either.

Us8etLppAFRAJfoYFXcttQ.text: This one is a solid 3. Don't get me wrong, we enjoyed our protein pancakes and scramble just as much as the next Joe...but we haven't been back to US Egg since we went a few months ago, and you're talking to two of the biggest breakfast fans out there. If your looking for a safe, tried and True breakfast place that won't let you down, but won't blow your socks off either, then give Us Egg a shot. They've definitely got some good choices of food on the menu, but somehow this place just didn't hold our attention like some other breakfast spots have. I mean, even there name is so generic and blah..US Egg... how original is that? I think this is definitely a few steps above Denny's, but being a step or two above Denny's is not a very hard thing to accomplish. They should maybe start striving to be a few steps above Denny's and then maybe it will be worth making a second trip back.

fsNUYWZD1zFfRt7phe6QuA.text: Food was best breakfast we have had - Half and Half with Protein Pancakes and omelet is best thing on menu!   Service was eggcellent!  We wanted to go back the next day to have another breakfast there before we left town.

Znz5pbgCVRGdw7_21d-TCQ.text: The place is cute, food was fresh, and the service was good. But, the food was blah. I was very disappointed, hoped for something more. You can get better food and MUCH better prices across the street at Denny's.

fUnK95g6195BSYslUD1krA.text: The food was good, and our server and her trainee were very nice and helpful.  But the food was just good (which deserved 4 stars) but the manager seemed more interested in talking to the hostess than smiling at customers or asking them how they're doing as he walked by.  It's a chain, what should I expect?

gcIhSdDSyYLQ3dyHcNVwxA.text: US Egg is one of my favorite "typical" breakfast places -- nothing fancy with standard breakfast foods. If you have a hankering for pancakes, you must have the protein and blueberry cakes! The skillets are very good as well. I like that the owners are always visible, and friendly. I definitely prefer a local spot over a chain, even if I have to wait a little longer for a table.

Y6N3zcPWdKGOffbXoFWW8g.text: Have been here before and food was very good.  This time we went for breakfast and there was glass in one of the dishes. Manager was called and comped one breakfast, even though our morning breakfast outing was ruined. Didn't even comp the coffee!    I think that money is more important to them than satisfying a customer that had glass in their food.   A horrible experience.    Would have returned if manager apologized and did not charge us for breakfast.

RVozsF7fYkhpt0c8tpDMUA.text: Just LOVE the PROTEIN PANCAKES with Extra Blueberries!!!!......The place is always packed, but has plenty of staff to handle the crowds!  Been there 6-9 times  and they have a wonderfully stocked menu of choices.....

NFsfv0vRlchwtbr0YFi6yA.text: I really enjoyed my waffles with blueberries.  They said fresh blueberries but mine looked really small and dark (as if they had been defrosted).  Maybe I'm spoiled by the huge NJ blueberries.  Anyway, my waffles tasted fine with the berries (whatever they were).  The coffee was good too.

2q-ETp7zlSYI7lhGUSC2OQ.text: I love this place for breakfast.  Everything I have ever ordered has been good.  I normally stick to my Eggs Benedict (I get the California style w/ avocado and tomato) and call it good.  But here I have tried the breakfast burrito, the whole wheat pancakes, the protein pancakes, the huevos rancheros, the veggie omlette, chocolate chip pancakes, and it was all good!  Yeserday I saw they have a pumpkin pancake, I think I'll wait for the holiday spirit to hit me before I try that one, but I'm sure it will be awsome.  If I had to gripe, I wish they had a bar for mimosa's and Bloody Mary's, but I should probably cut down on my morning drinking anyway.

i8EnlgqRNhHqqGKlPO02XQ.text: The most friendly service, beautiful waitresses, and the food was amazing. We were in n out in less then 30 min! Prompt to service. Food was made fast and tasted delicious. I got the hawk-eye egg white omelet and it was very filling! My buddy's got the skillet and they couldn't even finish it! Everything amazing and tasty. WILL come back when i am back in Arizona.

XC0ItOL01UAdug6LagmMlA.text: Great Breakfast food...expecially the skillets. Consistent style and portions...I really like the chicken, bacon, avocado skillet. However, I'm not a big fan of the coffee...i think it's quite bitter. but they have fresh squezzed O.J....and great whole grain pancakes.

MI4wfO4ZuQdvRz99jcFZhw.text: I give this place a solid three stars...it was a pretty typical breakfast place, nothing special.  I had the vege skillet which was ok except some of the potatoes were undercooked and some overcooked...GF had eggs Benedict an the eggs were over done as well.  Hollandaise needed more lemon:  I would eat there again but it's not  the best breakfast I have ever had!

8KtFn92uVI8WKF6hiu_1cw.text: Great breakfast restaurant just south of Old Scottsdale. Good service. Average $8 entry...$6 for 2 eggs. potato and english muffin

kjIV1kgJaEUBNAWU9vkizw.text: Great Breakfast! They even leave water and a coffee pot at your table. They had new hash brown potatoes today. The old one were like fried chips. The new ones are 100% better love them. As for the protein pancake a must try it's great.

3eq-H7LiSInPmowH634mVg.text: A straightforward breakfast restaurant executed very well. Menu is everything you would expect, they do have some 'Arizona Mexican' options such as Sonoran Burrito and Green Chili and Chorizo Omelette. Pancakes are deliciousness, I really like the protein and blueberry. Sometimes when I go I want an espresso drink, but they only have coffee. I've been here a bunch, and definitely prefer it over chain places like IHOP, Denny's, Village Inn, etc.

iTG52ngvFR7krrNHBcpSFg.text: We can only catch this place on the weekend, they close by 2 and sometimes there is a wait, but every time we have gone, the food has been excellent. You can order the food the way you like, requesting egg whites, no tomato, whatever you need to rearrange the omelette's or other choices to your taste and the food comes promptly. Large menu which also has lunch items and combos, not just breakfast fare. Nice fruit plate, options for Vegetarians, Omnivores and Carnivores. The wait staff is pretty attentive, keeps up on refills and smiles. The price is about where good breakfast food is these days, this isn't a 99cent breakfast slam, it's approximately 8 bucks per choice, other things are a la cart so it's really simple to get what you like. I got the California Benedict, with just right amounts of canadian bacon, avocado, hollandaise and english muffin. The potatoes weren't burnt or raw, and I could season them myself. Other people got spinach florentine, frittata, steak and eggs, protein platter. Serving size is just right, for the lighter eater, might be a little left over. They can split checks when you ask. Parking lot is decent sized, but this place is popular. My advice is visit around 8:30am. You'll beat the crowd and be very happy.

6HiEg058QZFZV65Adpf3Mw.text: Breakfast here was great!  Highly recommend it!  Seeing what the rest of Scottsdale has to offer, I was disappointed that they didn't serve dinner.

c6-B3u2s5-EuPCzrP2Eq3g.text: Probably the only reasonable option for a Sat/Sun breakfast place in its area. Good food, quick service. The place is always busy, but wait times are short. They lose a star because as they became more popular, the quality of the food began to diminish in the sense that it seemed rushed. For example, I always order my hash browns extra crispy now, just so that they'll be cooked right, sometimes bacon comes out undercooked, etc. If you're in south Scottsdale and looking for a good breakfast place that won't be a hassle or a long wait, you can't go wrong with US Egg. I recommend the skillets, or the chicken-fried steak and eggs. And always get a side of bacon.

ixMANM7yk4XjpKd-BUDeCw.text: After reading Brian's review of this place, it makes me want to go back and try a burger.   Predictably, I stuck with my instinct when I went to U.S. Egg and got . . . eggs. I know, I know. Not very original. But, for the record, it was the Eggs Benedict, actually. And they hit the spot.   The setup was Denny's-esque and we almost felt like we were in a cubicle as we ate breakfast. So, that wasn't good. Our server was friendly but it looked like her section had atleast twelve tables in it and it was busy so she barely had time to breathe.   The breakfast was tasty, despite the bleak setup, and it worked effectively as a good hangover buster on that weekend morning. I'll be back in there sometime soon, I'm sure.

5y4EyNP6NvU6b5ZyoHE3LQ.text: You're sure to see the hungover Scottsdale crowd that you ran into the night before at US Egg on most weekend days. The restaurant is usually PACKED from 9 a.m. to Noon, but the food is worth the wait. I love the Chalet French Toast and Protein Pancakes. The staff is friendly. And since they give you small glasses filled with soft drinks, they'll usually give you a pitcher so you can refill your own drinks. The Egg, as I like to call it, is also a celebrity hot spot. Barry Bonds, Ice Cube and his wife Coco and Joe Rogan have all stopped in for breakfast at this yummy eatery.

wR_QGFOM-sNu9lGT9q1N9Q.text: Went on a Sunday mud-morning and the wait was just about 10 minutes, not too bad. Had the protein waffle & bacon. The waffle was delicious and I would order it again! A friend ordered the club sandwich & it looked great!

cXlPWkroKe70xhc7FO1tNg.text: I'm back in Scottsdale and had some time for breakfast and thought I'd stop in. The wait staff was great my server was incredibly helpful and attentive. I ordered scrambled eggs, English Muffin, hash browns extra crispy with bacon - $9 and change. All o can say was it was fine... You're  US Eggs it should be more than fine! It should be awesome the best... I may give it one more shot- next time i'll go to the Denny across the street were I can get a fine breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Morning breakfast

1L_8M_lyUpfeNr8dW8Erog.text: I would highly recommend this place over any Denny's or IHOP. The food is much better in quality, while being comparable in price range to other diners.  We were seated very quickly, and the waitresses were tentative and kind.  Great for large parties, and for anyone who needs some standard, fill-you-up breakfast or brunch!

ZoQdeLoZIajFAkC-mfZQGA.text: My family and I ate breakfast here on a Sunday morning while on vacation. There are a ton of options. I had the Hawkeye omolette. It was very good. My wife had poached eggs, bacon and pancakes. My daughters each had a nice sized kids breakfast for $5. The portions are generous and the prices were what you would expect for a decent breakfast. The service was excellent. I would definitely come back here.

aloFg5X0Bu0XSyet7E5OsQ.text: Idaho skillet and protein pancakes!!! Amazing! Also the wait is quick even if there are a lot of people! The service is also fast and friendly. Everything was served hot and together.

qiphZJLc5k8W1M3fLKw_kw.text: 2nd time I have been here, great breakfast restaurant !  Yummy  breakfast , fast friendly staff! The wait staff are pretty nice and usually  typical breakfast places have grumpy staff ( I don't blame them I'm not a morning person lol)  Staff seems to very well organized & restaurant is clean and happy!   I have had the same waitress both visits , she is very sweet & told me the protein pancakes were nothing to be afraid of! And she was right- very delicious!   Love they serve cocktails & beer!

iKVeK5chWIs_0m4ef0oOtg.text: Horrible Service! From the time we sat down to paying the check...  How do you mess up a BLT & Fries? I'll tell you how "COLD AND FLAVORLESS"!  Cold coffee and floats in the water!  My husbands omelet and hash browns were Luke warm and had NO FLAVOR!   Absolutely worst breakfast ever!

9EBVvilkceBDKx_AM4TTqQ.text: The Going South omelette did not disappoint! 4 stars overall for their ok service and not crispy enough hash browns.

Adi7XOYUojCx1xFepvs71Q.text: DOG FRIENDLY!! I first need to speak to the outdoor patio! It's 90 degrees today & I wanted to find a dog friendly place but big issue is that even if the place had a patio, it's too hot! I called, they told me it was very well shaded & had misters. And they were right, the patio was full of people & extremely comfortable and NO FLIES! Something about the heat brings flies but not one found here!  On to the food. Great selections, great taste. I used Yelp to find this place and saw all the skillets, and had to try one. Our server was adorable, young girl, very friendly and chatty. She was at our table for a good 10 minutes just telling us about the area.   The menu has a bunch of protein selections, like protein pancakes, waffles etc, which is really neat when you are trying to eat clean. (I am on vacation so I just skipped that section) but if I had a U.S. Egg near me in California, I would be there much more often which would allow me to select better choices for my waist line. My bf got the protein pancakes with blueberries and said they were delicious.   Why not 5 stars? I think the pricing is a bit high for the portions. Yes, the food is quality but its standard eggs, potatoes, yogurt, oatmeal, nothing too unique here. Maybe its because the location is in Scottsdale? I don't know, I went to another breakfast place yesterday morning in Scottsdale called Randy's (the prices were fantastic, like mouth dropping prices!!

0HPKV7omspWD6m5A68Jqdg.text: I offer this as a warning to others:  My experience at this restaurant was exceptionally bad, although it wasn't due to the atmosphere or the service. The food my girlfriend and I received was undercooked, soggy, and unseasoned. We should have sent it back considering the price, which was not cheap. I was immediately sick, and spent the rest of the day lying in bed or in the restroom.  This is the first and last time I will be eating here. Quite simply, this was the worst food I have ever had at a restaurant.

FNlk5mi1vhmZxiN5OnTwyA.text: Love this place its perfect for breakfast and I gotta say the service was extraordinary.  I mean the waitresses all had smiles and came across like they really cared about the customers here.  Now this is a place I'll definitely come back to when I'm on this side of town.

JGUi_-SKdQmxkJzcNyYnuA.text: Pretty good breakfast and blazing fast service. Had quite a nice omelet this morning. I'd give 3.5 stars if I could but it wasn't quite up to 4 stars. Typical Az coffee ( which usually sucks) but a nice omelet and the fruit was fresh.

mUnx98CmYMxiBACHttvfEg.text: Been here twice so far, and one of the few breakfast places I've been to that actually serves corn beef hash (I love the stuff). It was pretty busy both times, but the waitresses I've had on my visits were prompt and pleasant. Definitely a place I'd go to regularly on the weekends.

XIP6FlFmb12lYj0nf56ibg.text: It's breakfast... Done well. How does anyone not like breakfast food!  US Egg does breakfast really well. And they have creative menu items too. I love their protein pancake. And they have some really crazy skillets that literally have everything in one dish. Biscuits and gravy, hash towns, and a chicken fried steak all stacked on top of each other. Is it healthy? Absolutely not. Is it awesome? Heck yes.

Q-KjU9ix9oFITByfkTWogA.text: I had the Cheese Chorizo Omelette, coffee, and a side of Sausage. The Omelette was excellent but the side of sausage was horrible, I'm pretty sure it was microwaveable Jimmy Dean Sausage Links, no joke! Also, it's roughly 7 dollars for coffee and the a side of sausage which is outrageous.   I'll skip on my next trip to Scottsdale.

VoZa8WuAE_pAzR_5PdvCyg.text: Love the food here. The manager on duty did a great job handling the morning rush.  The bacon onion and pepper skillet tasted fresh from the garden!

9tVU8VtLbNbQL3xP0gvE6w.text: I've been here before while in Scottsdale. I really like the food. I've had the 1/2 &1/2 which I think is awesome!   The gentleman at the door is always so nice and always there. Today I had a protein breakfast. It was good just what I needed! Yes I think you can mess up eggs but they didn't. A big plus. Bacon & sausage was cooked just right. No complaints on the food.   I was disappointed in my server this time. She came to my table 4 times..................  1) to take my order 2) to drop off my food 3) to drop off my check 4) to take my money  Normally the service is excellent, but I must say, Amber I was truly disappointed. I'm sure I'll be back for the food but not in Amber's section again! I'm sure I would've given 5stars if my service was good. I hate bad service.

JV9p40RJuSJpDYfrEIx8AQ.text: My beloved friend and I decided to come here after driving across the country. We googled breakfast places in the area and this was one of the highest rated. After reading the plethora of delicious options, we decided to give it a shot. Portions were perfectly sized and delicious. We left comfortably full. Our waitress had a bubbly personality and had a great sense of humor. Although it was a Tuesday morning, the waitress could probably tell that we were EXTREMELY hungover, so she provided us with a full pot of coffee and a large pitcher of water without a request haha.

l8-oLvjbKFiO6tuTNOsfhA.text: My new favorite breakfast spot. Hash browns were golden brown no burned spot. Bacon was crispy and delicious. I also had scrambled eggs with an English muffin. Never had a muffin so good. The service was amazing and food came out quick. At least 2 different servers came up to me and asked if I was good. The Manger came and refilled my water. Good spot to eat excited to bring the gf here next time.

ROKUiN9Pqs8LFkWtxjGwqw.text: We had breakfast here and it was one of the best I have had.  Great atmosphere, service, and food!  It will be a must stop for us in Scottsdale.  The protein pancakes are great.

l8qSpQViuiiWD-BYj0pEHA.text: Love this location been to the Tempe location wash as fond of it but the patio out here are nice a huge and relaxing atmosphere is peaceful

Fa9m1dQ4H_jLCIBNliP_SQ.text: Loved the place. It is large but well organized- fast service. We did wait less than 10 minutes for a table. Food was delicious, bacon thick and crispy, coffee hot and fresh(we got our own coffee thermos) I had the Arizona frittata! It was well cooked and vegetables were crisp, chocolate chip pancakes big and good no need for syrup or butter. Fruit plate large and sweet. Service very nice!!

yc-7dZ3E7KsPL2t63BgXSw.text: The food is great and the service is great. Busy Sunday morning and there we about a 15 minute wait.   The host who I believe might be the owner was very welcoming. I gave him my name and we were seated outside.  About 45 minutes later on our way out the door; the owner says " Have a good day Eric" .... I was totally floored that he remembered my name after dealing with all the customers.  Our server Laura was very attentive. I definitely recommend U.S. Egg.

fn8orQbvNKCu-G9lLHGDGA.text: Arrived at 2pm as the wife wanted breakfast for lunch and even though the restaurant was in the homestretch of their day, everything came out hot and fresh as if we had arrived at 8am. The steak was thick and flame-broiled and I opted for French fries over broccoli. Be sure to get a side of ranch as it pairs well with the fries. Wasn't able to confirm this, but I think they cut their fries in-house...very tasty and crisp, nonetheless. I love the old school brown coffee mugs they serve the coffee in and the fact they serve actual cream with your coffee rather than those little plastic cups you have to peel open. They did bring a carafe, so we were able to just refill our cup rather than waiting for our waitress. Will definitely go back!

OYAmCq9YuH7ct5AF8aKrow.text: My mom is in town for Christmas and this is her favorite place for breakfast.  She loves the protein pancakes.  Service here is always great, food is fantastic.  Back again with my mom who's visiting for Mothers Day weekend...as always, great service & awesome food.  Server was fantastic and the host was a charming gentleman.

pt6z4uponZlAr00Cz57qtw.text: Best hearty breakfast in town.  And a very good deal.  Owners and staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome.  Service with a smile and a fist pump.   Old school service.  I eat here every weekend.

lSCny1ABSF7DTa1ViDv7PQ.text: I love this place. I've always loved this place. The staff are friendly and attentive, the food is amazing (especially the protein pancakes and the peanut butter banana dessert thing). SOOOO good. The manager has a completely straight face and I thought he'd be sort of rigid and serious, but he was super nice and helped us out at every turn (I had a big party that changed in size several times before we were finally sat). I've eaten here dozens of times and I'm comfortable saying that every time will be great based on past performance.

SL74b0Y7O-sjIjgdwgGZtA.text: Items seemed kind of pricey - $2.50 for coffee, $2.50 for 2 sausage links, build your own omelet started at over $9 & additional toppings were $.95 ea. Nice clean restaurant.  Friendly staff. Overall, not the best experience, but not the worst

sgdiHipX40CDG5nqQPC6xA.text: Great food, great service! Have been here now a handful of times and it is quick and delicious. As pretty kid friendly because it's noisy so no one noticed my 2yo making lots of noise

DEHy_c2PR3DOmtyQKL_Mlg.text: It's was okay; service okay good this is why I gave a three star.    Food was not much to brag about. Stepped out of my comfort zone ordered a bloody marry, bacon one and I have to say it was good just a little two spicy of what ever they used, it killed the other flavors.   Family ordered omelettes, son ordered basic breakfast(eggs bacon nothing special) and I ordered the chicken fried steak.   All came out cold and I don't think I actually had steak if I did it was paper thin. Has browns looked like someone chewed them up and spit them back in the plate. Not worth what we paid . I won't be coming back.

03db6Ep0LIsPWPTym5PlFg.text: Had a very enjoyable breakfast here, the sour dough toast is amazing. Beautiful establishment and the workers are so polite. Would definitely come back

fragJ13nUKOgSdTHDywvyg.text: Absolutely delicious food and great service. They were able to get us seated in a timely manner and split our checks without a hassle. My friend and I both ordered the mimosa flights and each of our breakfast entrees were delicious. Highly recommend this place.

Service was great and the interior pleasing to the eye.  We had a late breakfast as we are visiting on vacation, so there was no wait and the diner was only a quarter full.

NYHZuei0f876j-i2hfwh8w.text: Came back here 10 months later and my review is exactly the same. What consistency!! Good food and great service!  Nice size portions and cooked just the way I asked. Went here for breakfast, definitely worth it.

n6H45W52BlBqI-GpVlXujA.text: Pancakes, waffles, skillets the menu is quite extensive. Portions are generous and pricing is decent.  -Coffee $2.99 -banana pancake $6.69 -chocolate chip pancake $6.69 -garden omelette $10.99  The Coffee was perfect and refilled every time. pancakes are huge about the size of a dinner plate, a small portion is good for one person. I wasn't particularly a fan of the protein pancakes they are not your usual fluffy ones. The eggs came with a side of muffin and hash. My muffin was burnt and the hash wasn't done but the server was quick to change them once i pointed that out.  I would love to try the other items on the menu but the service was much better than the food.  Cheers!

VVW4PdiD-JEvt8QhaBnZFw.text: I'm a rather picky eater, and I loved this place. I had a burger with a fruit plate and loved every bite. I never finish my food, but here I did! The staff is extremely kind and understanding. They even let me order off the smaller portions menu!

G1qQvCDft5oegU253yPnBQ.text: Nothing too fancy here.  Wide variety of food.  Clean restaurant.  Pancake offerings look good, but this restaurant does not feature 100% maple syrup.  Not available for an extra charge, either.

zYIapQtZ9pwCZz8KFItt9w.text: Another restaurant that's run correctly ! Great customer service ! Kelsie was our server, she was GREAT !! Fast service, great tasting food and clean. That's what makes a great restaurant, bam !!!!
