Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Egg carton flag

5WbLy68JCeip8M7YPa4_YA.text: We love this place.  The food is consistently  good, the staff is friendly and the patio is pet friendly.  It's not cheep, but it's a great weekend place!

aCwYsHVymtq7fV5HXjULcg.text: If you want a delicious, down home breakfast, then US Egg is the place for you. Don't expect to leave the place hungry...read on....  We had breakfast at US Egg before leaving town after a getaway night in Scottsdale. The interior is clean, the staff is very friendly, and the environment is bright, the signs are quirky, and it's a rather fun place. I ordered the South Omelette with chorizo, cheese, onions, and other veggies. It was huuuuuuuuuuuge and came with hash browns and an English muffin. The breakfast was larger than the breakfast I typically eat at home, but I snarfed this down with no problems or guilt. When something is this good, who can count calories, eh? US Egg also caters to gluten-sensitive and the requirements of gluten-free meals for customers. They have a fairly extensive gluten-free menu and they even made a fresh gluten-free hollandaise sauce for my wife and her omelette.  Also, the staff were very friendly and the vibe of US Egg is very much like a neighborhood restaurant where everyone knows your name and you always look forward to going there.   Overall, if you love breakfast and are in Scottsdale, I highly recommend US Egg. It's just good down home comfort breakfast food. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. South omelette.
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Front of menu.
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Entrance sign.

dSbotsMCUY6gQkf8KtT-Qw.text: I went in for brunch this morning with my mom, and forgetting that every place would be slammed on a Saturday, we were having trouble finding a place that would not have a long wait. Fortunately, we went to this place last minute after calling ahead to ask for hold times to which I was replied with "no wait time".  We went in, and only had to wait for less than a minute for us to get a table in a full house. Our server, Ti, was EXCELLENT. She was very attentive, kind, and was super helpful when my mom accidentally spilled some ketchup on herself. We were very impressed with her service, that we gave her a handcrafted coap from our business that we run as a thank you.  I had the strawberry pancakes with over medium eggs and hashbrowns. She had the blueberry oatmeal with a side of eggs. It was so delicious, and It didn't make me feel super full and bloated that starched pancakes normally would. It's a huge benefit that they make whole wheat pancakes, with decent servings.   I like that they have the coffee pot and water pitcher readily available for you at the table. It takes pressure off the server and customer for when they want refills and how much of a serving they want.   The place was well lit, clean and the bathrooms were very clean too.   Overall, I had a great experience and would come back again!

IEvD26CdDmD_82fXVhtySA.text: We like this place based on their Protein Pancake. Not sure how good it is for you but it taste good! The servers are super friendly. The only knock is the coffee. It's terrible. I can only give it 3 stars. Please switch to Starbucks or another premium brand as I can't drink it.

HUKsH8-JbfErKowm1-PkCg.text: Doesn't disappoint. Food is always consistent and service is pretty quick, even when it's completely packed. Servers are always cheerful and full of energy. Good choice for a weekend breakfast/brunch.

-WAb4JZTy0jq18O3ccdKLg.text: This place is amazing! Great service and great food. I recommend the protein pancakes and the bacon, onion, and pepper Idaho skillet. Christine & Heather are great servers. I will defiantly become a regular costumer.

Gl8DC01ygWI3KCJ-KyhNZw.text: Protein Waffle is to die for. This local institution is a fan favorite for all SF Giant fans attending spring training at Scottsdale stadium. I have to say the food here is delicious. I always get the triple play combo with their famous protein waffle. The protein waffle is their Belgium waffle batter with granola, blueberries, cinnamon and other goodness mixed in. Mmmmmmm!!! I also love that their juices are fresh squeezed. I am subtracting one star though because the last time few times I went there the lack of service by the waitresses were subpar. It was neither spectacular or horrendous.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. America

s1y8selYtnIL2ZU-kzKazw.text: Had breakfast here. The food was plentiful and everything was absolutely delicious. Everything on my plate was well cooked. Staff was nice and attentive. Would go back anytime. Recommend.

lk7e-d9E30o0JqrBIBfg7Q.text: Ok.  I just paid essentially $12 for a disappointing brunch, and I'm not thrilled about this.  The Sonoran breakfast burrito sounded great-- eggs, chorizo, green chilies, jack cheese, and salsa are among my favorite things to put in a burrito.  This is gonna be awesome, I thought reading the description.  I was hungry and excited about breakfast.  Oh, how let down I was with that first bite! Reality intruded on my fantasy breakfast with extreme prejudice.  I had been burrito- blocked! First of all, the "meat" was not chorizo.  Chorizo is deliciously greasy (that good red grease that lets you know its for real) and bursting with spicy flavor.  My burrito had "chorizo" in it -- flavorless Sysco breakfast crumbles.  There were also some green things that may have been chilies, and some onions, but neither tasted like the things they were masquerading as.  The only thing I tasted in the whole thing was the splat of tomato salsa on top.  Seriously, the breakfast burrito from McDonald's had more flavor than this poor creature they served me! And you know I can't stand  McDonald's, it is the court of last resort! I was glad to see a decent selection of fruit on my $1.25 upcharge fruit plate.  No complaints there, at least until our server knocked the table flag (the standup display advertising specials, don't know what its officially called) over in the middle of it. Service was not great either, which also fed my irritation about breakfast.   We might be back (I'll get something else), but I can't see being a regular.

J29QZZNJ_mjrmQfrdeo6Og.text: Spinach florentine omelet w hash browns and english muffin. Tasty but portion very large. Didn't think to look for senior menu. Maybe next time. Very fast service.

fBeMKmFHp2wn5c5kNmu24g.text: I picked up a to go bagel sandwich before work this morning.  It was so fresh and delicious!!  It had sliced tomato, egg, and a fresh bagel.  The eggs had such a light and healthy flavor, and this was the freshest bagel I've ever had. It came with hash browns on the side, and a glass of orange juice that tasted freshly squeezed.  I would like to go and have a sit down breakfast here, and try some of the great variety of dishes that are on the menu.

0zZTS9pTMqaJlWWt-ZNR1w.text: Huge fan of the Egg, I use to live next to the one on Baseline. Points for the waitress filling our coffee cup 3/4 full so we have room for cream. Negative points for giving us the check half way through our breakfast, I feel like your kicking us out.....I hate that.   The food is always great, I've never had a complaint the 100 times I've eaten at US Egg.

p5saJTKzV1PiMRWJenLVdw.text: I got the breakfast plate that contained the most meat. I didn't even finish half of it. Very humbling experience. Over all the food was better than average but I'm more impressed with the quantity

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

A2V5elS-zxwdc75b9yuCHA.text: Fast seating for large parties.  They now serve GLUTEN FREE waffles and French toast! Yummy!!  Bacon is awesome too

L2QqQH3DWEYjki287cwSXw.text: This is one of my favorite places. They always make my food healthy just like I asked them to do. They're inviting. Right when I walk in they everything they can to get me in right away. Their menu is nice and big and has a lot of options

BX8Appb3tCYKQ660fNOl_g.text: I've heard great things about this place and when I was visiting Arizona I had to try! Glad to say I was not disappointed!  The atmosphere appears very clean and family oriented. The decorations are cool with bunch of egg crates making up the US Flag!   The service was great, attentive and fast.   I ordered the half and half which included the southwestern skillet and the protein pancakes! I was highly pleased.   Just a heads up, the portions are huge so you will either be stuffed or not finish. There are many skillet options I chose the southwestern and it was cooked to perfection. They make your eggs anyway you want them. Ask for your hash browns to be extra crispy. You're welcome in advance. If you don't know, the skillet is basically all the ingredients you choose based on your selection, the eggs of your choice and has browns all in one bowl.  The protein pancakes are heavenly! I need the recipe ASAP! It has blueberries and I'm not sure what else but I can't wait until I'm back!  The price is very affordable. Next time I will do another skillet for variety but I will stick to the protein pancakes.

Kw-j5B2mAygcJMyE7A8uHQ.text: Very good. The place is set up really nice. It is very clean. The staff are friendly. If tou want a great breakfast this is the place to go. Will be back here soon.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Breakfast is da bomb

-0n7N6cptCBepuIcALF8mQ.text: All four items our family ordered were sub par. If your name is US Egg, you better know how to cook eggs. My omelet was an under seasoned scrambled egg folded over poorly cooked and under seasoned veggies ( they also shouldn't be wet). The salsa I asked to pour over my omelet was also bland so that didn't help.   The up-charged fruit that came with my dish was lukewarm and over ripe making it very bitter. Ew.   My husbands "poached" egg was over cooked making it hard as a rock. His $10 skillet was bland with under seasoned veggies, dry-as-a-bone chicken, and under cooked potatoes.   My kids' pancakes were way dry. They only picked the apples out and left the pancake.   Overall, we were way disappointed. I guess short shorts and beer Doesn't make for a good breakfast.

2bgbilgBE1yCCYbuZa3N7g.text: I absolutely love this place for breakfast!!! Sometimes of you go in early afternoon for breakfast, its not as good as the morning cooks (soggy french toast, overcooked eggs, almost burned ham), but overall its awesome!  Try the protein pancakes, you will be hooked!  We've gotten to know a few of the waitresses and they are all friendly (except for one blonde one who is more interested in showing her ass off to rich looking dudes than her tables).   Try it! You will not be unhappy.

L9AIfSn46OxpDrNlbvTqDg.text: Very good service bumps this breakfast spot ahead of the new Paradise Bakery. The menu could use a refresh and I'd love to see some healthy omelettes. It seems every time I have come here, they are really friendly, and differentiate based on service.  Free wifi is a big plus! I have never tried the lunch as breakfast continues to be really great.

z_bLK3uZq93yGQlLbKfEjQ.text: This place has the best breakfast/brunch by far! Closes at 2:30 so get there early because the place fills up quickly and there is a steady stream of folks waiting to partake in a great meal. Indoor and outdoor seating. Waitstaff can be more attentive, but the place is always super busy! I tried a skillet...ham, sausage, mushrooms, bacon, and tomatoes on a bed of hash rounds then covered with cheese! DELICI'! All the food and beverages came very promptly to the table.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Skillet

vN7j_FC4MOnu6hobbMa_tw.text: Not bad! The service was fantastic, and it's a light, airy, nice space to eat a meal in. I enjoyed the ambience and the branding is well done.  The food was pretty good and they give you plenty of it. The waitress was very careful to take note of my nut allergy and check with the kitchen on my order and have it cooked on a separate griddle from where the protein pancakes are cooked (they contain tree nuts). The pancakes were huge and pretty tasty.   Everyone was happy with their food. I think we'd come here again. It's not the most gourmet breakfast in the world but it's good. Coffee was pretty bad, sadly.  I'd like to try a scramble next time. They sounded pretty great.

pvnEzX7nYxEs3ErhzmkzUw.text: I had a peaceful and enjoyable breakfast at the US Egg Restaurant today. I ordered the Meat Lover's Skillet and it was very tasty and filling. I stayed for a while after eating since I was waiting for my car to be fixed at the Ford dealership nearby. They had no problem with it whatsoever and were welcoming.  The building was clean, the staff were friendly, and the ambiance of the room felt homey.  I would consider coming back again for breakfast again!

Hu3N5VsXnZWpcW0HGXdzMA.text: I am not a breakfast guy, but when I do eat breakfast out US Egg is my first choice.  I'm glad I dont have to travel far for this place and lucky its so great!  The menu is huge and something for everyone including lunch options.  Cocktails? why yes please!  It's always busy but the well trained staff handles the volume well, service is always terrific!  I would chose this over Lo Lo's any and every time!!!!!!

ZF1WERPwbpLMO5p00k29IQ.text: Sundays are my favorite day to come here. Families and friends are enjoying the restorative powers of an easy day. They seem to have more time for the "long version" and another cup of coffee.  The food here also seems to be at its hottest and best on Sundays. Definitely a great way to start the week.

Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Protein pancakes are the Bomb!

6G3pZSybXKMyc9F-Wxu1dg.text: I was looking for a breakfast place on my way and stopped by here in a whim. The place was not very busy with only a handful of customers and I was seated and served right away. After perusing their menu I settled for the Half and half, which is a larger meal with 2 "small" protein pancakes and half of their skillet with 1 egg. It filled me up and tasted amazing. The pancakes were fluffy for being made of protein batter and had granola and some dried fruit inside. It really hit the spot. If these were small I can't imagine what the full sized ones look like. I got the Santa Fe skillet, which had diced chicken, chorizo and green Chile on top of hash browns and cheese with the egg on top. Really tasty. Very casserole-like. I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of food and you can be sure I will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Half and half with the Santa Fe skillet

Mb2yyy74NhsIAK0RZUOivQ.text: Starting with the positives. Went for breakfast on Friday am. No wait for a table. Place was bright and clean. Waiter was at table promptly. The bad (or room for improvement)- coffee was Luke warm. Wife's order was incorrect, which was odd since it was simply a breakfast order off their menu. Mine came out at the same time, they took hers back to fix it. Manager dropped off a few pieces of fruit " for her to munch on" while waiting--but did not receive an apology for the error. Waiter didn't even stop by to apologize at all. Food was standard, nothing out of the ordinary. Based on reviews, I was expecting a bit better. Waiter dropped off bill, never apologized (again). Substandard service at best.

2NyOlN5p1QeKlzLp4bVdsQ.text: Standard traditional breakfast place.  Good quality ingredients, friendly services, spacious decor.  Coffee is good, bottomless, but not your Starbucks espresso drinks.  "The Border" was quite tasty, with a bit spiciness to make it more interesting.  I came back the 2nd day, since it's the most interesting choice in walking distance, and tried the spinach Florentine, there were bacon bits and hollandase sauce on top.  It was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Border

vQYwR-i7SSY_rB_PQyhryw.text: On our way to our weekend Road Trip, we decided to stop by here for a quick breakfast. It was a pretty busy day for the restaurant. All the tables were full, and the servers seemed a bit harried.   My wife got there before I did, as I was having the car checked out before our road trip. I got there about a half-hour later. The server had already given my wife her drink order, and came by to get me mine. That part went well, and I did find the young woman to be pleasant.  After perusing the menu, my Beloved decided on the chicken and waffles. I chose their Triple Play Combo with a side of toast. It took some time for our orders to come out, likely due to the large crowd of customers there at that time. When they finally got to the table, unfortunately my toast and syrup were missing. It took some more time to finally get them.  That being said, as you can tell from the pictures, the food was well prepared. My pancakes were fluffy and delectable. Plus, the bacon was nice and crispy, just the way I like it. My wife enjoyed her chicken and waffles, especially the egg. She hates runny scrambled eggs and found the scramble here to be quite good.   We liked the country decor and the friendly service. It would have been nice to have received our order more expediently, but I give them a pass for the busy day they were having. We'll be back again some time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffles
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Triple Play Combo

ajG8rmB2AfjlwZd4UDzJQA.text: We have had great history with this chain in the Arizona Market. This was our first visit to this Scottsdale location and the results were very good as expected.  The host/hostess is always the first point of contact and we were greeted warmly and seated rapidly even though they were busy; efficient turns. This is a good choice in Old Town as those located right in Old Town usually have a 30 -45 minute wait. I'm not sure about you but when I want to eat, I want to eat!  The offerings are standard for a breakfast restaurant with a few of their own twists on the menu. Our service was excellent and our server looked like Mario Lopez... funny!  Our food came out at the proper temperature and the Mimosas went down smoothly. The decor is nice and the facility is well maintained and located next to the Carter; a higher end condominium community.  We would come back here in a moment and avoid both the wait and crowds. Delish and prompt stop. Put on your Arizona feed bag and drop in!  #irishcatv2 #twylytephotography #vino2ultimate #vinosquared #vino2

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. You can a totally get in here as opposed to most in Old Town.

iXiPtpYCXOlyXNurYUGaAQ.text: Had a large group of people and wanted to find a place where we could all hangout over breakfast. Reservations were made here and it was the perfect place.  The service was fast, which was nice due to having some very hungry little kids as a part of the group. The restaurant was loud and family friendly. The food was classic American breakfast and just what was needed!

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QtDbfHrjZLQrMvLEolubiw.text: Easily my favorite breakfast spot! The owner always welcomes my family when they are in town. Kansas City Scramble and Protein Pancakes are my favorite. Keep up the good work!

wxJWP1yDAfPlgQhuuTrZ_w.text: I went a few weeks back and it is only because a buddy I was hanging out with wanted to go. I thought this place was just another chain bland place. Although it still had that vibe to it, I did enjoy myself. I had a half skillet and pancake combo. I enjoyed the heck out of both. This cracks my top ten breakfast options.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Skillet and pancakes

yghwKZkGWf-RV2EFP-o3hw.text: Great local "Denny's" with more local flair, mimosas and amazing menu options.   I love the half and half, half hashbrown skillet with a half portion of their protein pancakes. It's perfect because you don't have to decide between sweet or savory. The protein pancakes are something I crave, incredibly flavorful with warm spices, oats and blueberries. The skillets have a wide variety to choose from, wide variety that goes from veggie to meat lovers.   If you order coffee they leave the carafe there for you which is nice, you can add more to keep your coffee hot.   The tall ceilings make the place feel very open but most of the tables and booths have a decent amount of privacy. There is outdoor seating, lots of big parties were out there.   Waiters and waitresses are always very friendly and very attentive. It's a little expensive for the environment you are in (think Denny's with $15 omelettes) but much more relaxed than anywhere else in South Scottsdale.

Sbt4vI4YpJlatO9GgDg5hQ.text: Gavin was our server and we had the best experience on our first visit to US Egg in Scottsdale! We will definitely return! Thanks, Gavin, for the excellent service! We enjoyed our meal, too. Great food and atmosphere!

skwsZpMrVPTghfRCxrJgwA.text: Beyond words. Us egg went above and beyond duty. They managed to get all 45 members of my group not only in the restaurant but not our own private section on a Sunday morning. For this, we all give you three cheers. We realized that was no easy task. The food and the service was outstanding. The items were not only tasty with large portions but the presentation was perfect. the manager George was the best I've ever seen. He covered everything from a to z. When we left the place I felt like I known him for years. George took great strives to make sure everything was absolutely perfect for our visit. The menu had a great selection and made it easy to find something delightful. I'm glad we chose u.s. egg 4 hour Sunday morning breakfast and it was so wonderful that they could find the time and space to squeeze in a group of our magnitude. Special thanks to you George. My hat's off to you buddy. We'll see you next time. Sincerely, Fred Fred's Playland

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0snu7tXFf1l_rEjH4r-3EA.text: In town for the wknd and my friend suggested we go here. I wasn't sure what to expect. Thankfully there wasn't much of a wait. If you're really REALLY hungry, don't worry. You'll leave here stuffed. There's so much food on the plate you won't know what to do with it. My chicken omelette was huge. Overall the food was heavy, but ok.

3em_yeJFEhaHy9v4j_54dw.text: A few of us went here for breakfast. What a nice treat. A great location with optional seating outside with decent views. I went with your traditional breakfast, eggs, hash browns well done, toast, bacon and sausage. Based on the pics I saw on yelp I went with a side order of bacon, which was the right call. The bacon was juicy and greasy, hehe...just how you want your bacon.    As for toast and English muffins, they were slopped with butter, where most places skimp on the butter, this place did no such thing.   I tried the omelet, but wasn't thrilled with it, but that was after everything I ate, so that may have been part of it.   Also I ordered a fresh apple juice, which was more like an apple cider for us Michiganders...overall, I'd be back. The menu was huge; much more for me to try.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dQazlgVAv5t7LpQt6QZT5w.text: I came in the morning and I was greeted by Samantha (one of the waitresses) and the owner whom I had a nice talk with and really got to know a little background of this restaurant. Both were very nice and friendly GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE. This place is very large and has a nice customer base. US egg is a family owned business and has been in the family  for many years. Their food is fresh and great quality! they do not use pre frozen ingredients like most chain restaurants. If you're ever in the area I highly recommend you come here. Their portions are great , you always have enough to share. In the morning they have coffee set outside that they offer for free. I highly recommend looking around at the Yelp pictures and checking out the menu. This is a great restaurant I'm sure everything is very good. I will definitely come back when I'm in the area.

9dEiL62FvEJSDAeF-2iObQ.text: The service was nice the waitress anayelli I believe was excellent the food lacked flavor big time, jst not enough salt & pepper or seasoning. the hash browns were undercooked

niSye2LG-9q0AcCQMwOFyg.text: Went here for lunch and ordered the Mushroom Swiss Angus Burger.  Decent.  It came with a salad.  Decent as well.

BjcCQzi7T5VepdH2ILyVWQ.text: The food is decent and the service is slow and rude but it's convenient and usually easy to get a table.

L4BC-2BIuPuQIMTuEbSkyw.text: good grub and fast.  me and my wife have been there like 5 times and each time it is always great.

0CwSSa5q0fB3fGGQY027bw.text: Excellent food & service! $30 for breakfast for 2, but large portions ! Love the atmosphere and photographs.

qpDfBQmurTiWOck8NYWOyA.text: Protein pancakes for the win. Nothing better after hiking Camelback.   Would recommend to anyone looking for a solid breakfast joint.

OWK7rZXs-FQ0Jww7stuNTw.text: Wow... time flies when you're having fun.  I just realized I haven't updated my review for U.S. Egg in over two years, so the below is long overdue.  And just because I'm feeling creative today, here's a little something I wrote in honor of U.S. Egg:  U - ultimate place to go for a delicious breakfast S - super friendly staff  E - eggs, pancakes, waffles, and so much more! G - giant portions G - grateful... that's how I feel about having this place so close to home!  I was reminded of how much I enjoy this place after our delightful breakfast this morning.  There was a less than five minute wait to sit down, but the hostess brought me an OJ while I waited which made me very happy!  Once seated, our waitress came over to help us navigate the menu... it had been awhile since our last visit.  Per her recommendation, I went with a half order of the blueberry whole wheat pancakes and a side of egg whites.  A half order is plenty for one person fyi - it comes with a pancake as big as your plate!  It was delicious! J had coffee and a 2 egg breakfast with english muffin and hashbrowns.   I love that they leave a pitcher of water and a carafe of coffee at your table... and fyi this place has plenty of lunch options as well.  If you're looking for a casual place that is consistently good, head over to U.S. Egg... I have to remember to do so more often!

meZiIvUQx9_9VX-CMwrQKg.text: I don't know about you but a great Friday night for me, normally eludes to a not-so-great Saturday morning, at least that was the case until I stumbled, more literally than I care to admit on Yelp, into US Egg.  Ok so it might be a little chain-y and menu's aren't crazy creative, but when it comes to great morning after stodge, you really can't top this place. Typically American large portions of; scrambled egg, hash browns and a choice of bacon or sausage (little tip, ask for a combination) all for under $10 is an absolute steal!  Throw in unlimited (oh how I love the land of the free) coffee and a chocolate chip pancake to measure and you're well on your way to rolling home a happy camper without denting your wallet!

WTswfy9FK1Tmr2l6ZsZ5-w.text: Once again in town for medical appointments and stopped by for breakfast and lunch on consecutive days. The food was great, I especially like their grits at breakfast, but the egg dishes are really the best. Once again we had the pleasure of Bailey as our server, she is special, outstanding and prompt service, thank you.

YK8aXKATkcOULG_0il1FTA.text: Delicious!  Had the chili omelette, was amazing. So were the potatoes. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town.

_9sX2kX4v84a_0rpBjANCg.text: Nothing but wonderful, positive things to say about this business!  We've been enjoying their delicious food for probably 25 years now and we've followed them all over the valley!  You won't be disappointed when you spend your time and money here.  Excellent food!  Fabulous service!  Wonderful environment!  We love U.S. Egg and the family that owns it.  We've never had a bad experience and I can't think of too many places that I can say that about.

x1sOfLoQc25SZsuH4lSN6w.text: This brunch spot is dynamite! The food here is always consistent and relatively inexpensive. Not to mention that the service is amazing. Whenever I visit Scottsdale I have to come here. Weekend waits can be long which is expected. Trust me you won't be disappointed. Enjoy!

8576mZNbHFsEvPKsaO3uow.text: Came in to two smiling faces, was sat in Heather's section and it was an experience. Nice lil restaurant, bigger than i thought but still enough of a home feeling to make me stay at least a half an hour longer than i planned on anyway! Very attentive service even though it was a slow day, im sure they pick it up even more when its busy. I recommend turning for that protein pancake mix into a waffle, i was crazy surprised.

WNCii0l6dbaislHL7fOs7Q.text: What a great place for breakfast. This is a family owned business with a great business model. Great service, great food, immaculate restaurant. We were in town from Las Vegas and found this place on Yelp. The food was good and plentiful, it came out quickly. They give you a carafe of coffee so you aren't looking for your waitress to refill your cup. In spite of being super busy on a Saturday morning, we had our food in 10 minutes or less. What a surprise. I give them 5 thumbs up

tVEZd8SN_MrTFdfr370yLQ.text: This place gets your order out faster than any breakfast restaurant I've ever been to. Awesome food, big portions, plenty of seating, very friendly all-female waitstaff.

Hyy2jlGkTBLiL_1Yq0UyBQ.text: I just love it here. Brittani was my server today and everything came fast, fresh and perfect. I got the half n half, which is a half skillet of your choice with 2 nice size protein pancakes. I was by myself and my bill (I got a hot tea and side of sausage) was 27.00 with tip which is a little high for breakfast but I just love this place.   Its always clean, comfortable and fast. I always have great service as well. A female manager came by and asked how things were, which I love!

b75GydXepkeZBm-4GPtpAw.text: It was very crowded for Father's Day!...but that is to be expected and is a positive showing for the business!!  As busy as it was, I was seated within 20 minutes and the service was prompt!...  I wanted to order eggs benedict but I have to confess that I used the photos and comments in YELP to show the waitress that some people complained that the eggs were overcooked...and I soooooooo wanted good-soft-and runny eggs in my benedict....she was right on top of it and it turned out PERFECT!...Yummmmmmmm.  The juice was fresh squeezed O.J. And the coffee was very tasty, not like it was overdone or old...  I give them four stars because there is no readily available bike rack outside....and this was my 1st time here on a holiday...so I need to wait until I come back and see if they are consistent.  PS...Great menu selections too!  Out.

HJGLdZRxcKoyOm6dip7vcw.text: Love going to US Egg for a yummy breakfast during the weekends. Be prepared as you will most likely have a wait of 15 to 20 minutes. There were 3 of us in our party and we waiting maybe 15 minutes and it was about 11am on a Sunday. We got seated inside and our server came over (she was great). I had the Eggs Benedict, my boyfriend had the 1/2 and 1/2 skillet and protein pancakes and our friend had the spinach and mushroom omelet. Everything came out perfectly and without a long wait for food. I have been to several other nearby breakfast spots and no one can seem to poach an egg propertly but not US Egg! They get it right every time!!!

MgR8OctzdOJqi9eHllTn1g.text: Food is always great but love their gluten-free menu including their gluten-free French toast. It's incredible. Most places have very bland gluten free food but they use spices on their toast that make it so yummy. Definitely worth a try for GF foodies.

photos.caption: Photo of US Egg Restaurant - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gluten free French toast!  killer

8zz2fXfWTW9HYrPo0Z68DA.text: Couple of my friends took me to this place saying it's really good and it turned out to be True. Let me start with their coffee which is amazing, I didn't expect that from a breakfast place. And I liked their protein pan cakes and "Bay Area French toast". If you're in or around Scottsdale, you better try this place for breakfast or brunch.

JIg5sEXd3D7wCTS0AOeQMg.text: One of my favorite things about living in Scottsdale is all the breakfast options. Does any city love breakfast more than Scottsdale? US Egg is one of many entries on the scene and it is a good one. The best? No, but it is a reliable spot that i can count on. My fav order is the Eggs Benedict. Theis location always seems to be busy and have a vibrant atmosphere.

AvqdqqMvw98YoxHdw6EoBw.text: Love US Egg.  One of my favorite restaurants.  No matter how busy they always seem to find a place to sit.  I always get the same thing and I love it.  I order the Santa Fe half and half with protien pancakes.  The quality is great and so is the service.  Its the first place we go when we get to Scottsdale.

hWI3G9VNkU9pte_sSlO7Zw.text: Okay, I don't even like sausage or chorizo or anything that comes in a casing. But the chicken chorizo scramble sounded good for some reason, and it was probably the best breakfast I've ever had in my life. I got the half and half of course because I can't live without those amazing protein pancakes. But the chicken scramble with chorizo was just insane. I don't even have words to describe it. I wanted to cry it was so good. Please just go here and get exactly what I ordered. For the record I told her to hold the tomato, it just didn't sound like the right ingredient to keep in the mix, and I was happy without them even though I normally love tomato, just not for breakfast.  I better start planning on how to convince my boyfriend we need to go back here again ASAP.

7E6DtN3wXwFWsmK1eWZAZQ.text: Plenty of parking space made me love this place even more. I tried protein pancake like anybody else. It was great. Nice servers, they gave us a pot of coffee and jar of water so that we don't have to get their attention to get refill ... and they serve alcohols which I didn't know!! Next time my breakfast will be with Bloody Mary.
